Despite investor skepticism reflected in its depressed stock price, Morningstar analysts see an appealing opportunity with a 27% discount to its fair value estimate and a 3.11% dividend yield.

title: New Investments Ready to Propel AV Technology Forward
summary: New investments are rapidly advancing autonomous vehicle (AV) technology, with major automakers and tech companies pouring billions into R&D to enhance safety and performance. While full autonomy and mass adoption are long-term goals due to testing, regulatory, and infrastructure challenges, early commercial applications like robotaxis present immediate growth opportunities. The article details technological advancements, investment trends, regulatory hurdles, consumer acceptance, and the potential for AVs to revolutionize transportation.

title: Metaverse Technology Redefining Digital Experience
summary: The metaverse is emerging as a significant technological advancement, moving beyond gaming to redefine digital experiences across various industries. Companies like Facebook (Meta), Nike, and Microsoft are investing heavily, with projections indicating global metaverse revenue could approach $800 billion by 2024. While offering potential for retail, enterprise solutions, and new markets like virtual real estate and entertainment, the metaverse also faces challenges related to data security, legal frameworks, skilled resources, VR device limitations, and potential negative societal impacts.

title: Nvidia investing $10M in last-mile company Serve Robotics
summary: Nvidia is investing $10M in Serve Robotics, a last-mile delivery company that spun out of Uber. Serve Robotics utilizes Nvidia's Jetson edge compute module for its autonomous mobile robots, making this investment a continuation of their long-standing partnership. The funding will support Serve Robotics' expansion and fleet building in existing and new markets.

title: Why Nvidia sees a future in software and services: Recurring revenue
summary: Nvidia is shifting its business model to focus on software and services to generate recurring revenue, moving beyond its traditional hardware sales. CFO Colette Kress highlighted opportunities in autonomous vehicles, where Nvidia's software will be monetized over the life of the car, and the metaverse, envisioning annual revenues of $1,000 per creative user and per digital twin bot. This strategic pivot aims to create more predictable income streams, leveraging existing hardware with new software offerings and expanding into new markets.

title: Vodafone investigating threat from hackers behind Samsung breach to leak source code
summary: Vodafone is investigating claims by the hacking group Lapsus$ that they have obtained 200 gigabytes of the telecommunication giant's source code and are threatening to leak it. The company is working with law enforcement and states that the repositories referenced typically contain proprietary source code, not customer data. Lapsus$ recently claimed responsibility for data breaches at Samsung and Nvidia.

title: Nvidia invests $10M in sidewalk robot delivery company Serve Robotics
summary: Nvidia has invested $10 million in Serve Robotics, an Uber spinout specializing in sidewalk delivery robots. This investment marks Nvidia's first foray into the sidewalk delivery sector and is part of a broader collaboration to advance robotic technology. Serve Robotics will use the funds to expand its service beyond Los Angeles and San Francisco, leveraging Nvidia's Jetson AI platform, perception, and mapping tools to enhance its fully autonomous delivery robots.

title: GLOBALFOUNDRIES ANNOUNCES NEXT GENERATION IN SILICON PHOTONICS SOLUTIONS AND COLLABORATES WITH INDUSTRY LEADERS TO ADVANCE A NEW ERA OF MORE IN THE DATA CENTER
summary: GlobalFoundries (GF) has announced GF Fotonix™, its next-generation silicon photonics platform, aimed at addressing the explosive growth of data and reducing power consumption in data centers. GF is collaborating with industry leaders including Broadcom, Cisco Systems, Inc., Marvell, and NVIDIA, along with photonic innovators like Ayar Labs and PsiQuantum, to deliver innovative and feature-rich solutions. This monolithic platform, combining advanced photonics features and RF-CMOS on a single silicon wafer, is designed to enable faster, more energy-efficient data transmission and supports various high-growth markets.

title: Nvidia hackers allegedly attempting to blackmail company into open-sourcing GPU drivers
summary: The Lapsus$ ransomware gang, responsible for a recent attack on Nvidia, is allegedly attempting to blackmail the company into open-sourcing its GPU drivers. The attackers have threatened to leak sensitive GPU files if Nvidia does not comply with their demands by a set deadline, which also included a previous request to remove mining hashrate limiters. Nvidia has confirmed a cybersecurity incident where employee credentials and proprietary information were stolen, but denies ransomware deployment.

title: Use WGMI to Enter the Crypto Economy
summary: The crypto economy is diversifying beyond direct Bitcoin ownership, with new ETFs like the Valkyrie Bitcoin Miners ETF (WGMI) offering access. WGMI focuses on bitcoin mining equities and is actively managed, allowing it to adapt to a nascent asset class with high growth potential. The ETF also incorporates a renewable energy overlay for its mining components, addressing environmental concerns associated with bitcoin mining.

title: Veritas NetBackup 10, IBM FlashSystem Cyber Vault And Rambus HBM3
summary: This article discusses key announcements from Veritas, IBM, and Rambus in the technology sector. Veritas introduced NetBackup 10, an evolution in cloud-based data protection with enhanced features. IBM unveiled its FlashSystem Cyber Vault and new FlashSystems, while Rambus detailed its HBM3 high-performance memory.

title: Texas Instruments Inc. stock outperforms market despite losses on the day
summary: Texas Instruments Inc. stock experienced a slight drop of 0.03% on a generally grim trading day for the market. Despite this loss, the company's shares outperformed major indices like the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average, which fell more significantly. Texas Instruments also performed better than several of its competitors, with a trading volume exceeding its 50-day average.

title: Nvidia is set to spend at least $10B to secure its share of limited 5nm chip supply
summary: Nvidia is reportedly planning to spend at least $10 billion to secure a significant share of TSMC's limited 5nm chip supply for its upcoming Ada Lovelace GPUs (RTX 40 series). This substantial investment is crucial for Nvidia to potentially achieve higher clock speeds and better power efficiency, giving them a competitive edge over rivals like AMD. The move highlights the intense competition among fabless companies for advanced chip manufacturing capacity, with Nvidia having already spent $9 billion on inventory and prepayments in a recent quarter.

title: Nvidia Posts Record Sales Amid Broad Chip Demand
summary: Nvidia Corp. reported record quarterly sales of $7.64 billion, a 53% increase from the previous year, and projected further growth. The graphics-chip maker also more than doubled its net income to $3 billion, surpassing Wall Street expectations for both profit and sales. This strong performance comes amidst broad chip demand, despite the company moving past its failed takeover bid for Arm Ltd.

title: Intel to Buy Israel’s Tower Semiconductor for $5.4 Billion
summary: Intel Corp. has agreed to acquire Israel’s Tower Semiconductor Ltd. for $5.4 billion as part of CEO Pat Gelsinger’s strategy to expand into the outsourced chip-manufacturing business. This acquisition aims to enhance Intel's expertise and customer base in the chip-foundry market, directly competing with industry leaders like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. The deal is expected to close in about 12 months and is a key part of Intel's broader investment cycle to modernize its factories and rebuild manufacturing capabilities.

title: Will Cisco Buy Splunk? Big Tech Bids $20 Billion on Public Company
summary: Cisco Systems has reportedly offered $20 billion to acquire software company Splunk, aiming to expand its presence in the software industry. The potential acquisition faces regulatory hurdles and comes as Splunk navigates a leadership transition and business model shifts. Both companies' stocks reacted differently to the news, with Cisco's stock slightly down and Splunk's significantly up due to investor sentiment regarding financial backing.

title: ETF of the month: VanEck Semiconductor UCITS ETF (SMGB)
summary: The VanEck Semiconductor UCITS ETF (SMGB) has been named ETF of the month, highlighting its impressive performance in 2021 by returning 44.4% and gathering $859m in assets since its December 2020 launch. The ETF has benefited from increased demand for semiconductor chips driven by global digitalization, the reopening of economies, and emerging technologies like electric vehicles and 5G. Despite some recent market concerns from hedge fund selling, the semiconductor industry is projected to see continued revenue growth in 2022.

title: Nvidia, SoftBank Call Off Blockbuster Arm Deal - WSJ
summary: Nvidia and SoftBank have abandoned their $40 billion deal for Nvidia to acquire chip-design specialist Arm due to significant regulatory antitrust concerns. SoftBank, which owns Arm, now plans to pursue a public listing for the U.K.-based chip business. Nvidia will take a $1.36 billion charge against earnings related to the deal's termination, and SoftBank will retain the $1.25 billion prepaid by Nvidia.

title: Nvidia’s Arm deal: Largest-ever chip merger terminated over ‘significant regulatory challenges’
summary: Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm Limited, which would have been the largest chip merger in history, has been officially terminated due to significant regulatory challenges globally. SoftBank, Arm's parent company, will retain a $1.25 billion breakup fee from Nvidia and plans to take Arm public by March 2023. Analysts suggest the termination is a "plus" for Arm, allowing it to maintain impartiality as an IP purveyor, and while a "setback" for Nvidia, it won't derail its progress in AI.

title: Nvidia to withdraw from acquisition of SoftBank’s Arm
summary: Nvidia is abandoning its US$40 billion acquisition of British semiconductor design firm Arm from SoftBank due to significant regulatory opposition. SoftBank now plans to pursue an initial public offering for Arm, expected by March 2023. Arm's CEO, Simon Segars, has resigned, with Rene Haas taking over.

title: SoftBank’s sale of Arm to Nvidia collapses, Arm to IPO
summary: The proposed sale of Arm Ltd by SoftBank Group Corp to U.S. chipmaker Nvidia Corp has collapsed due to regulatory hurdles and scrutiny from various international bodies. Instead of the sale, which was valued at up to $80 billion, Arm will now plan for an initial public offering (IPO). The deal faced opposition from U.S., British, EU, and Chinese regulators over concerns about competition, pricing, and innovation in vital chip markets.

title: Doomed from the start? Why Nvidia failed to buy Arm from SoftBank
summary: Nvidia's attempt to acquire Arm from SoftBank has failed due to significant regulatory challenges and widespread opposition from various stakeholders. Critics, including tech giants and regulators, raised concerns about job security, tech sovereignty, and access to Arm's chip designs. SoftBank now plans to list Arm on the stock market in 2023, with discussions ongoing about the listing location.

title: Nvidia’s $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm collapses
summary: Nvidia's $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm has collapsed due to insurmountable regulatory hurdles, leading Arm to pursue a stock market flotation instead. The deal, which had been valued as high as $75bn, faced fierce opposition and regulatory scrutiny in multiple regions, including the US, UK, and China. Softbank will now prepare Arm for an IPO and receive a $1.25bn break-up fee from Nvidia.

title: Nvidia becomes 7th-largest U.S. company as it passes Facebook owner Meta for the first time
summary: Nvidia Corp. has surpassed Meta Platforms Inc. to become the seventh-largest U.S. company by market value. This shift highlights Nvidia's rapid growth over the past few years and Meta's recent decline, which saw its market value drop by $267 billion since Wednesday's close.

title: WEKA and Cisco funding contribution: Now you see it, now you don’t
summary: WEKA initially announced Cisco as an investor in its $73 million funding round, but Cisco's name was later replaced by Digital Alpha in a corrected release. Digital Alpha, founded by a former Cisco managing director, describes itself as an alternative asset manager with a strategic collaboration agreement with Cisco Systems and preferred access to Cisco’s commercial opportunities. This change highlights the close ties between Digital Alpha and Cisco, effectively positioning Digital Alpha as a Cisco investment vehicle.

title: NVIDIA Corp: the red flags for this stock investors need to know about
summary: This article discusses the trajectory of NVIDIA Corp.'s stock, highlighting its strong performance due to high demand for GPUs, driven by the global semiconductor shortage and boosted by record third-quarter earnings in November 2021. However, it also suggests that there are "red flags" that investors should be aware of, although the details of these flags are withheld for members only.

title: Is chip giant Nvidia going to scrap its $40BN bid for Arm?
authors: Giles Turner and Peter Elstrom and Bloomberg
summary: Nvidia is reportedly preparing to abandon its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Ltd. due to fierce regulatory backlash and little progress in securing approvals. Regulators and customers, including the U.S. FTC, have expressed concerns that the deal would make Nvidia too powerful. SoftBank, Arm's current owner, is stepping up preparations for an Arm initial public offering as an alternative.

title: CES 2022 Recap: Tech Becoming More Accessible and Interoperable
summary: CES 2022 showcased significant advancements making technology more accessible and interoperable. Key trends included enhanced immersion in the metaverse with new AR/VR products, traditional auto OEMs committing to mass-market electric vehicles, and the emergence of a unified Internet of Things ecosystem through initiatives like Matter. The event highlighted a shift towards practical, everyday applications for emerging technologies, signaling potential disruptions in various sectors.

title: Intel investing $20 billion to bring chip manufacturing to Ohio amid global shortage
summary: Intel announced an investment of over $20 billion to build two new semiconductor chip factories in central Ohio. This project aims to address the global chip shortage and reduce the U.S.'s reliance on Asian manufacturing for semiconductors. The initiative is expected to create 3,000 Intel jobs and 7,000 construction jobs, with production slated to begin in 2025.
source: ABC News - Breaking News, Latest News and Videos
source_domain: ABC News - Breaking News, Latest News and Videos

title: Intel to invest at least $20 billion in Ohio chip-making facility
summary: Intel Corp. plans to invest at least $20 billion in a new chip-making facility near Columbus, Ohio, to bolster its semiconductor production in response to increased demand for digital products and a global chip shortage. This investment is part of Intel's broader strategy to expand its manufacturing capabilities and regain its position as a leading chip designer and manufacturer, including for other companies. The move is expected to create 3,000 permanent jobs in Ohio and comes at a time when governments are offering subsidies to attract semiconductor production plants to reduce supply-chain disruptions.

title: Chip giant Nvidia expands R&D operations in Israel
summary: Nvidia is expanding its R&D operations in Israel by establishing a new design and engineering group focused on next-generation CPUs for AI, robotics, and autonomous vehicles. The company, which acquired Israel's Mellanox Technologies in 2020, plans to hire additional engineers in Israel, further solidifying the country's role as Nvidia's largest R&D hub outside the US. This expansion intensifies competition for tech talent in Israel, where both Nvidia and Intel have significant R&D presence, and Google is also entering the chip-making sector.

title: Serve Robotics achieves autonomous robo-delivery milestone
summary: Serve Robotics has achieved a significant industry milestone by completing the first-ever commercial deliveries using Level 4 autonomous vehicles that require zero human intervention. The company's robots are equipped with advanced sensors and AI computing to navigate autonomously, drastically reducing the need for remote operators. This achievement marks a major advancement in robotic delivery, bringing the industry closer to fully autonomous operations in various environments.

title: These 3 ETFs let you play the hot semiconductor sector, where Nvidia, Micron, AMD and others are growing sales rapidly
summary: This article discusses the semiconductor sector as a potentially excellent area for investors, even amidst rising interest rates. It highlights how chip exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have significantly outperformed major benchmarks. The sector's growth is exemplified by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.'s strong fourth-quarter results and substantial capital expenditure plans for 2022.

(TSM) reported significant increases in its fourth-quarter sales and earnings, signaling a robust outlook for the industry.

title: NVIDIA Named America’s Best Place to Work on Latest Glassdoor List
summary: NVIDIA has been ranked as America's best place to work on Glassdoor’s 14th annual Best Places to Work list for large U.S. companies in 2022. The ranking is based on anonymous employee feedback, with 95% of NVIDIA employees recommending the company and 98% approving of CEO Jensen Huang. This recognition highlights NVIDIA's commitment to employee satisfaction amid evolving workplace expectations.

title: AI Startup Speeds Up Derivative Models for Bank of Montreal
summary: Riskfuel, a Toronto-based AI startup, has partnered with Bank of Montreal (BMO) to accelerate its derivative models using NVIDIA DGX systems. This technology significantly improves the performance of complex financial calculations, enabling BMO to make faster and more accurate investment decisions and expand its client base. Riskfuel's solution allows banks to run derivative portfolio models in seconds, offering both speed and accuracy.

title: JVAL Stock Price | JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF (JVAL), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and comprehensive financial metrics such as dividend yield, expense ratio, and market capitalization. It also offers technical analysis insights and lists the ETF's top holdings, outlining its investment strategy as a value-focused equity fund targeting the U.S. market.

title: Nvidia’s Omniverse ‘metaverse for engineers’ emerges from beta
summary: Nvidia's Omniverse, a "metaverse for engineers" designed for 3D simulation and design collaboration, is now generally available for free to Nvidia Studio creators with GeForce RTX gear after a successful public beta. The platform offers new creative features, including AI-enabled 3D face modeling animation and is being utilized by companies like Ericsson to optimize 5G network buildouts by modeling signal propagation in virtual cities. Omniverse leverages Nvidia's RTX GPU technology and Pixar's Universal Scene Description for real-time collaboration and simulation across various industries.

title: What Crypto-related ETFs Could Hit the US Market in 2022?
summary: The article discusses the potential for various crypto-related ETFs, particularly metaverse products, to launch in the US market in 2022, while the approval of spot bitcoin and ether futures products remains uncertain. Industry experts express apprehension about the immediate investability of metaverse ETFs due to potential crossover in holdings and a lack of pure-play names. There's also skepticism regarding the SEC's approval of a spot bitcoin ETF in 2022, with some analysts expecting an ether futures-based ETF to gain approval sooner.

title: Intel appoints 10 Israeli executives to senior global positions
summary: Intel Corporation has appointed 10 Israeli executives to senior global positions, including Karin Eibschitz-Segal as a global corporate vice president, making her the second Israeli woman to hold such a role. The appointments highlight Intel's appreciation for its Israeli human capital and come amidst a global semiconductor shortage, underscoring Israel's growing importance in the tech industry. Intel is the largest private employer in Israel, with significant development centers and manufacturing plants.

title: Here are the top-performing technology stocks of 2021
summary: This article highlights the top-performing technology stocks of 2021, despite a challenging end to the year for the sector. It focuses on companies like Upstart, Synaptics, Asana, Fortinet, and Nvidia, detailing their impressive growth, revenue figures, and contributions to areas like online lending, IoT, collaboration software, cybersecurity, and high-performance computing. The report underscores how specific companies thrived amidst broader market volatility, with several achieving triple-digit gains.

title: Federated learning: Intelligence versus privacy—can we have both?
summary: This article discusses federated learning (FL) as a solution for machine learning at scale while addressing data privacy concerns. It highlights FL's benefits in industries like banking and healthcare, enabling shared AI model training without sharing sensitive data. The article also covers design challenges related to privacy in FL and how NetApp's infrastructure solutions can help in data protection and governance.

title: Desktop computers and All-in-One PCs
summary: HP offers a wide range of desktop computers and All-in-One PCs designed for various uses, including work, entertainment, gaming, and creative tasks. The article highlights new AI PC models like the HP OmniDesk and OmniStudio X, alongside established lines such as HP Pavilion, Envy, OMEN, and VICTUS, detailing their specifications and intended applications. Customers can filter choices by use case, series, operating system, product type, and screen size to find the perfect device.

title: Intel to invest $7 billion in new plant in Malaysia, creating 9,000 jobs
summary: Intel Chief Executive Pat Gelsinger announced a $7 billion investment to build a new chip-packaging and testing factory in Malaysia, creating over 4,000 Intel jobs and more than 5,000 construction jobs. This expansion aims to address the global semiconductor shortage, which Gelsinger expects to persist into 2023. The new advanced packaging facility is projected to begin production in 2024.

title: Intel plans to take self-driving car unit Mobileye public
summary: Intel announced its plan to take its self-driving car unit, Mobileye, public in the United States by mid-2022. This deal could value Mobileye at over $50 billion, with Intel intending to retain majority ownership and Mobileye's executive team. The move aims to build on Mobileye's innovation track record and unlock value for shareholders, as Intel faces pressure from activist investors regarding its chip manufacturing operations.

title: Intel plans to take self-driving car unit public in the U.S. in mid-2022
summary: Intel announced its plan to take its self-driving car unit, Mobileye, public in the U.S. in mid-2022 through an IPO. Intel acquired Mobileye for $15.3 billion in 2017, and the IPO is expected to value Mobileye at over $50 billion, creating value for Intel shareholders who will remain majority owners. This move aims to give Mobileye more visibility and help fund Intel's expansion plans, including building new chip plants.

title: Nasdaq dives over 2% as tech stocks slide at end of volatile week
summary: Wall Street's major indexes, particularly the Nasdaq, experienced a significant decline as tech stocks slid at the end of a volatile week. This downturn was influenced by mixed jobs data, uncertainty surrounding the Omicron coronavirus variant, and the Federal Reserve's policy tightening signals. Major tech companies such as Apple, Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Amazon, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla all saw their shares fall, contributing to the broader market dip.

title: U.S. FTC sues to block Nvidia deal to buy Arm
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued to block Nvidia Corp's more than $80 billion acquisition of British chip technology provider Arm, citing concerns that the deal would give Nvidia undue control over crucial computing technology and designs. This move complicates an already challenging regulatory path for the acquisition, which has faced opposition from the chip industry and scrutiny from British and European Union regulators. The FTC argues the merger would harm competition, reduce innovation, and lead to higher prices by giving Nvidia the ability and incentive to undermine competitors who rely on Arm's technology.

title: Regulators in US, UK, EU All Alarmed By Chip Maker Nvidia’s $40B Deal to Buy Chip Designer
summary: Regulators in the U.S., U.K., and E.U. are expressing alarm over Nvidia Corporation's $40 billion proposed acquisition of chip designer Arm Ltd. The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has filed a lawsuit to block the deal, citing concerns that it would grant Nvidia too much power and stifle competition and innovation in the semiconductor industry. Nvidia, however, maintains that the merger would benefit the industry, promote competition, and preserve Arm's open licensing model.

title: US sues to block Nvidia deal to buy British chipmaker Arm
summary: The United States Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued to block Nvidia's planned $75bn acquisition of British chip design provider Arm, citing concerns that the deal would give Nvidia control over crucial computing technology and design relied upon by competitors. The FTC argues that the merger could undermine competition, leading to reduced product quality, less innovation, higher prices, and limited choices for consumers. Despite the legal challenge and opposition from other regulators, Nvidia shares remained largely unchanged due to investor focus on its growing data center business.

title: U.S. sues to block Nvidia’s $40-billion chip takeover of Arm
summary: U.S. antitrust officials have sued to block Nvidia's proposed $40-billion acquisition of Arm Ltd., citing concerns that the deal would stifle innovation and undermine competition in the semiconductor industry. The Federal Trade Commission argues that the merger would grant Nvidia excessive control over chip designs widely used across various technologies. The acquisition, initially valued at $40 billion in September 2020, has faced regulatory hurdles globally due to Arm's critical role as a technology licensor to hundreds of companies including Nvidia's rivals.

title: FTC Sues To Block $40 Billion Nvidia - Arm Computer Chip Deal
summary: The Federal Trade Commission has sued to block Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of chip designer Arm Ltd., citing concerns that the deal would stifle competition and innovation in the semiconductor industry. Regulators in the U.K. and EU are also investigating the proposed merger. Nvidia, based in Santa Clara, California, vowed to contest the lawsuit and preserve Arm's open licensing model.

title: How a Stanford couple created Taiwan’s best-known AI start-up
summary: This article details how a Stanford couple, Chih-Han Yu and Winnie Lee, founded Appier, Taiwan's first AI unicorn. After eight failed attempts and nearly two decades, their company, which develops AI-based precision marketing solutions, went public on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in March, becoming a success story for both Taiwan's tech scene and Japan's IPO market.

title: Amazon's cloud unit launches new chips to take on Intel, Nvidia
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has introduced two new custom computing chips, Graviton3 and Trainium, aimed at competing with offerings from Intel, AMD, and Nvidia. AWS claims its new chips offer better performance per dollar and lower costs for machine learning model training compared to its rivals. This move signals AWS's continued drive to develop its own hardware and intensify competition in the cloud computing and chip markets.

title: Nvidia jumps after big data centre growth boosts outlook
summary: Nvidia's stock jumped after the company reported strong revenue forecasts, driven by significant growth in its data center segment. While gaming chip sales remain strong, and the company sees potential in the metaverse and cryptocurrency mining, its proposed acquisition of Arm Ltd. faces regulatory challenges. Nvidia's market capitalization has soared, placing it among the top S&P 500 companies.

title: Global X signals intent in Europe with seven thematic ETF launches
summary: Global X has launched seven new thematic ETFs in Europe, expanding its UCITS range to 12 products. These ETFs cover various themes including autonomous vehicles, clean tech, cybersecurity, e-commerce, fintech, IoT, and robotics/AI, with TERs ranging from 0.50% to 0.60%. This move signifies Global X's robust growth and commitment to offering targeted exposure to disruptive global themes for European investors.

title: Enphase Energy CEO Says You Should 'Stop Doing Stupid Things'
summary: Enphase Energy CEO Badrinarayanan Kothandaraman, 48, has led a significant financial turnaround for the solar products maker by applying principles of thrift and simplicity learned from his upbringing in India. His strategy focused on cutting costs, boosting gross margins, and fostering strong supplier and customer relationships, including a shift to competitively bidding for components and moving engineering staff to India. Under his leadership, Enphase joined the S&P 500, with revenue and share prices seeing substantial growth, driven by its microinverter technology and expansion into energy storage.

title: Chipmaker Nvidia forecasts robust revenue on AI, metaverse buzz
summary: Nvidia Corp forecasted fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations, driven by growth in its data center business and investments in artificial intelligence and the metaverse. The company's shares rose significantly following the news, reflecting strong demand for its graphics and AI chips in gaming, data centers, and autonomous vehicles. Nvidia's Q3 revenue also surpassed estimates, with significant rises in its gaming and data center units.

title: Qualcomm, diversifying from mobile phones, to supply chips for BMW self-driving cars
summary: Qualcomm announced that it will supply chips for BMW's next generation of driver-assistance and self-driving systems, marking a significant diversification beyond its core mobile phone chip business. This move underscores Qualcomm's strategic expansion into the automotive sector, aiming to challenge competitors like Nvidia and Intel in the self-driving technology market. The new chips will be used in BMW's "Neue Klasse" series of cars, with production slated to begin in 2025.

title: New VinFast VF e35 electric SUV revealed as Tesla Model Y rival
summary: Vietnamese brand VinFast is set to debut its new VF e35 electric SUV at the LA Auto Show, targeting rivals like the Volkswagen ID.4 and Tesla Model Y. Designed by Pininfarina, the VF e35 will offer a range of up to 250 miles and level 3 autonomous driving capabilities, with deliveries expected to begin next year. The vehicle aims to be competitively priced in Western markets.

title: Startup Embark Trucks Now Publicly Traded
summary: Embark Trucks Inc., an autonomous truck software developer, has completed its business combination with Northern Genesis Acquisition Corp. II and is now publicly traded on the Nasdaq Capital Market under the ticker symbols EMBK and EMBKW. The company, co-founded by CEO Alex Rodrigues (26), aims to commercialize self-driving trucks in the U.S. Sun Belt by 2024, leveraging its OEM-agnostic software and recent partnerships with industry leaders.

title: TSMC and Sony partner to build US$7bn chip factory in Japan
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) and Sony have announced a joint venture to build a $7 billion chip plant in Japan, aiming for mass production by 2024. The new factory in Kumamoto will be TSMC's first in Japan, creating 1,500 high-tech jobs and producing 45,000 12-inch wafers per month to address the global semiconductor shortage. Sony will invest $500 million for a 20% equity stake, with significant funding also provided by the Japanese government.

title: Aeva and Luminar deals show lidar gaining traction
summary: Aeva and Luminar, two lidar companies that recently went public via SPACs, are gaining traction in the autonomous vehicle industry. Aeva has partnered with Fabrinet for mass production of its chip-scale lidar modules, while Luminar's lidar has been selected for Nvidia's DRIVE Hyperion platform. Another lidar startup, Ouster, also reported a significant increase in sales and plans to launch a new automotive lidar platform.

title: CoreWeave, Specialized Cloud Provider, Raises $50 Million in New Capital from Magnetar
summary: CoreWeave, a specialized cloud provider focused on NVIDIA GPU-accelerated workloads, announced it has raised $50 million from Magnetar Capital to expand its infrastructure. This funding follows a period of significant growth for CoreWeave, with its total revenues on track to triple in 2021 and its cloud business experiencing 271% growth in the last three months. The investment will enable CoreWeave to further scale its offerings for high-performance computing, catering to diverse needs such as VFX rendering, machine learning, and digital assets.

title: Luminar Lidar Selected for NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion Autonomous Vehicle Reference Platform
summary: Luminar's lidar solution has been selected to be part of the sensor suite in the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion autonomous vehicle reference platform, which aims to accelerate the development of autonomous consumer vehicles with production starting in 2024. The platform will utilize Luminar's long-range Iris lidar for Level 3 highway driving, integrating it with NVIDIA’s high-performance compute and AI software. This collaboration is expected to provide automakers with an advanced platform for next-generation safety and autonomous capabilities.

title: Nvidia picks Luminar's lidar for self-driving tech, sending its shares up 15%
summary: Luminar Technologies Inc. saw its stock jump 15% after Nvidia announced it would use Luminar's lidar technology for its self-driving platforms. This news coincided with Nvidia's annual GTC conference. Luminar has also recently partnered with Volvo and is expanding into the Chinese market.

title: Supermicro Enhances Broadest Portfolio of Edge to Cloud AI Systems with Accelerated Inferencing and New Intelligent Fabric Support
summary: Supermicro announced enhancements to its AI GPU server portfolio, integrating new NVIDIA Ampere-family GPUs to deliver up to 10x faster AI inference performance and 3x faster training. These systems are designed for a wide range of applications from edge computing to cloud environments, critical for uses like autonomous driving, video streaming, and cloud gaming. Supermicro also introduced its Universal GPU Platform and systems supporting the new NVIDIA Quantum-2 InfiniBand product line, alongside optimized solutions for NVIDIA Omniverse Enterprise.

title: Innoviz Perception Solution Supported on NVIDIA DRIVE Platform
summary: Innoviz Technologies announced that its advanced perception solution is now supported on the NVIDIA DRIVE platform, integrating its LiDAR sensor and perception software into NVIDIA's end-to-end AI platform for autonomous vehicles. This collaboration allows Innoviz's technology to enable object detection, tracking, and classification, as well as obstacle detection and calibration, and is integrated with NVIDIA DRIVE Sim for development and validation. The partnership aims to accelerate the development and deployment of autonomous vehicles by providing customer access to Innoviz's LiDAR solutions within the NVIDIA DRIVE ecosystem.

title: AMD lands Meta as customer and takes on Nvidia, sending shares up 11%
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares rose 11% after announcing Meta Platforms Inc. as a new data center chip customer, intensifying its competition with Intel. AMD also unveiled new chips, including the MI200 for AI and machine learning to challenge Nvidia, and the Bergamo processor for cloud computing to compete with Ampere Computing. These strategic moves bolster AMD's market position against larger rivals and secure its presence with major cloud providers.

title: EXPLAINED: What is Metaverse and Why Facebook/ Meta Thinks it's the Future of Internet
summary: This article explains the concept of the metaverse, why Facebook (now Meta) views it as the future of the internet, and what its potential applications are. It details how the metaverse would work, from virtual interactions and business opportunities to the technologies being developed to build it, while also touching on data privacy concerns.

title: Arista Gains Big on Cloud Boom
summary: Arista Networks experienced significant stock gains following strong earnings and boosted guidance, driven by increased capital spending from hyperscalers like Meta and Microsoft. The company also continues to gain market share from competitors like Cisco in both data center, cloud, and campus networking segments, indicating a robust cloud boom across the industry. Other infrastructure vendors like NVIDIA, Amazon Web Services, and Broadcom are also seeing growth.

title: Nvidia Hits Record High as Stock Surge Nears 120% This Year
summary: Nvidia Corp. stock rallied to a record high, extending its 2021 advance to nearly 130%. The chipmaker's shares rose 12% in its sixth consecutive positive session, making it the biggest gainer in the Philadelphia Stock Exchange Semiconductor Index. Wells Fargo also raised its price target on Nvidia, citing opportunities in the metaverse.

title: Investing in Mark Zuckerberg’s vision of the Metaverse with an ETF
summary: This article discusses investing in Mark Zuckerberg's vision of the Metaverse following Facebook's rebranding to Meta. It explains what the Metaverse is, how investors can gain exposure through companies involved in its creation like Roblox and Unity Software, and highlights the Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (NYSE:META) which tracks a basket of such stocks. The article also provides information on thematic ETFs and the fund manager, Roundhill Investments.

title: Intel teams with Google Cloud to develop new class of data center chip
summary: Intel Corp and Google Cloud have collaborated to create "Mount Evans," a new class of chip called an "infrastructure processing unit" (IPU) aimed at optimizing cloud computing data centers. This chip separates and speeds up overhead tasks like setting up virtual machines, improving efficiency and security. Intel hopes to make this IPU an industry standard beyond Google, with both companies working on releasing free software tools.

title: AMD Grows Revenue In Sixth Straight Quarter Reveal Q3 2021 Results
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) reported significant revenue growth for its third fiscal quarter of 2021, marking its sixth consecutive quarter of revenue increase, driven primarily by its Enterprise, Embedded and Semi-custom segment. The company recorded $4.3 billion in net sales, representing a 54% annual and 12% sequential growth, with strong contributions from data center and custom-design chips. Despite a sequential drop in cash flows due to investments in long-term supply chain capacity, AMD doubled its operating income and achieved a 78% annual net income growth, with projections for continued revenue and gross margin improvement in the current quarter.

title: Aruba introduces the distributed data center switch
summary: Aruba has partnered with Pensando to unveil the CX 10000, a 48-port L2/L3 Ethernet switch featuring embedded Pensando ASICs for security services, load balancing, and firewalls. This distributed data center switch allows companies to build a switching fabric across multiple locations and integrates security directly at the leaf level to enhance performance. While it pushes for a change in traditional separate management of switching and security, analysts predict a significant future market for such integrated distributed switches, especially for large enterprises.

title: Check out Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026's stock price (CIFRW) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock information for Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026 (CIFRW), including its current price, historical performance metrics, key financial stats, and recent news. It highlights the company's profile as an industrial-scale data center construction and operations firm focused on bitcoin mining and high-performance computing, along with insights from analyst calls.

title: EU to investigate Nvidia's $54 bln ARM bid after remedies fall short - sources
summary: The EU is expected to launch an extended antitrust investigation into Nvidia's $54 billion bid for British chip designer ARM. This comes after remedies offered by Nvidia last week failed to address competition concerns, marking a second setback for the company after a similar warning from Britain's antitrust agency. The European Commission is scheduled to end its preliminary review on October 27, initiating a four-month investigation.

title: Understanding the Buzz Around the BUZZ ETF
summary: The article discusses the VanEck Vectors Social Sentiment ETF (BUZZ), which debuted in March 2021 and capitalizes on the "meme stock" phenomenon. It examines BUZZ's methodology, noting that its longer lookback period means it doesn't solely focus on highly speculative meme stocks like GameStop and AMC. Instead, BUZZ's portfolio includes quality names like AMD, Apple, Nvidia, and Pfizer, and exhibits low single-stock risk.

title: Nvidia offers EU concessions over $54 billion Arm deal
summary: Nvidia has offered concessions to the EU antitrust regulator regarding its $54 billion acquisition of British chip designer Arm. The deal has raised concerns within the semiconductor industry about Arm's neutrality as a technology supplier. The EU will now seek feedback before deciding whether to approve the deal, demand more concessions, or open a formal investigation.

title: GINN's Got the Goods of Quality Disruptive Companies
summary: The article highlights the Goldman Sachs Innovate Equity ETF (GINN) as a strong investment opportunity, particularly for those seeking exposure to high-quality, disruptive growth companies. Despite the S&P 500 Technology Index's flat performance in the third quarter, GINN focuses on larger, mature yet innovative companies with high return on equity (ROE), such as Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The fund's significant allocation to technology and healthcare sectors, combined with its emphasis on quality traits and R&D-focused companies, positions it well for continued upside.

title: CORSAIR Debuts their new XENEON 32QHD165 Gaming Monitor, featuring an ultra-slim 32-inch QHD screen
summary: CORSAIR has launched its new XENEON 32QHD165 Gaming Monitor, featuring a 32-inch QHD IPS LED screen with a 165Hz refresh rate and compatibility with AMD FreeSync Premium and NVIDIA G-SYNC. The monitor is designed for gamers and creators, offering excellent color accuracy, HDR400 support, and integration with CORSAIR iCUE and Elgato Stream Deck software. It also boasts a versatile design with a unique stand featuring a 1/4" threading for mounting accessories and comprehensive connectivity options.

title: Quick on Their Fleet: Kodiak Builds Flexible, High-Performance Self-Driving Trucks on NVIDIA DRIVE
summary: Kodiak Robotics has unveiled its fourth-generation self-driving truck, powered by NVIDIA DRIVE Orin. The trucks feature a lightweight mapping strategy and a discreet, modular hardware design to achieve level 4 self-driving capabilities, focusing on flexibility and live perception rather than detailed pre-constructed maps. This approach addresses the high demand for delivery and the shortage of drivers in the trucking industry.

title: Kodiak Robotics Unveils Its Next-Generation Autonomous Truck with Plans to More than Double Its Self-Driving Fleet
summary: Kodiak Robotics announced its fourth-generation autonomous truck featuring Luminar's Iris LiDAR, ZF Full Range Radar, Hesai 360-degree scanning LiDARs, Cummins X15 TM Series engines, Bridgestone Americas smart-sensing tire technology, and the NVIDIA DRIVE platform. These new trucks prioritize modularity, discreet sensor integration, and enhanced reliability to enable scaled production and easier maintenance. Kodiak plans to more than double its self-driving fleet with 15 new PACCAR trucks, expanding its freight delivery business in Texas and potentially other U.S. corridors.

title: Virtual prototyping tool for mobile, automotive and hyperscale systems
summary: Cadence Design Systems has launched Helium Studio, a virtual and hybrid prototyping platform designed to accelerate the development and verification of complex systems for mobile, automotive, and hyperscale applications. This tool allows early software bring-up and co-verification, significantly reducing design times for GPUs and 5G chips by enabling software and RTL bug fixing pre-silicon. It integrates with Cadence's existing verification engines, offering a unified debug experience and high throughput for developers.

title: Keycorp Stock Shows Rising Relative Strength Amid Surging Profit Growth
summary: Keycorp (KEY) saw its Relative Strength (RS) Rating increase to 77 due to strong earnings reports, including a 205% and 350% surge in year-over-year profit growth. Despite a fractional dip in its stock price reflecting market consolidation, the upgrade highlights the super-regional bank's positive momentum.

title: PayPal, Workday Lead New Names On IBD Breakout Stocks Index
summary: PayPal (PYPL) and Workday (WDAY) are identified as leading growth stocks on the IBD Breakout Stocks Index, both charging toward new buy points. Their inclusion also highlights the IBD Breakout Opportunities ETF (BOUT), which is also demonstrating breakout potential. JPMorgan recently downgraded PayPal, citing a slower-than-expected turnaround under its new CEO.

title: Musk Said to Oppose Nvidia’s Planned Takeover of Arm: Telegraph
summary: Elon Musk reportedly has concerns regarding Nvidia's proposed acquisition of semiconductor designer Arm, citing competition issues. The information comes from the Telegraph, which referenced multiple sources. This opposition highlights potential regulatory and competitive hurdles for the significant tech merger.

title: NVIDIA Stock Price and Forecast: Why is NVDA stock going up?
summary: NVIDIA stock continues to rise, hitting new all-time highs despite broader market nervousness ahead of the Jackson Hole symposium. A Reuters report about the US Department of Energy purchasing a supercomputer with Nvidia chips is cited as a catalyst. The article also touches on concerns from the UK's Competition and Markets Authority regarding Nvidia's proposed acquisition of ARM.

title: Synopsys' AI-Assisted EDA Tools Aim To Cut GPU Design Costs in Half
summary: Synopsys' new AI-assisted Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools promise to significantly reduce the cost and time required for chip design, particularly for GPUs. The DSO.ai platform can optimize various aspects of chip design, potentially cutting development time from 24 months to 24 weeks and reducing costs by as much as 50%. Companies like Samsung, Google, and Nvidia are already adopting this technology, which could also democratize chip development for smaller firms.

title: Nvidia Announces GA of AI Enterprise on VMware vSphere and Standard Servers
summary: NVIDIA has announced the general availability of NVIDIA AI Enterprise, a suite of AI tools and frameworks designed to virtualize AI workloads on VMware vSphere and NVIDIA-Certified Systems. This initiative aims to make AI transformative power accessible to a broader range of enterprises by leveraging mainstream data center servers. Several system makers and Domino Data Lab are supporting this launch, with early adopters already utilizing the software in various industries like automotive, education, finance, and healthcare.

title: Intel CEO Calls Chip Maker ‘Willing Buyer’ as Semiconductor Industry Consolidates
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger has stated that the company is a "willing buyer" as the semiconductor industry consolidates. He plans to use mergers and acquisitions to support Intel's revival strategy. Gelsinger expects consolidation to continue in the industry and sees Intel as a key consolidator.

title: Rambus Outs HBM3 Details: 1.075 TBps of Bandwidth, 16 Channels, 16-Hi Stacks
summary: Rambus has unveiled new details about its HBM3-ready combined PHY and memory controller, revealing specifications that promise a significant leap in memory performance. The new HBM3 standard could achieve up to 8.4 Gbps-per-pin, 1.075 TB/s of throughput, and support for 16 channels and 16-Hi memory stacks, more than doubling the capacity and bandwidth of HBM2E. These advancements are expected to radically speed up future GPUs and SoCs, with the first chips leveraging this design anticipated in late 2022 or early 2023.

title: Nvidia Q2 FY 2022 Earnings Report Preview: What to Look For
summary: This article previews Nvidia's Q2 FY 2022 earnings report, highlighting expectations for robust growth in adjusted EPS and revenue, though at a slower pace than the previous quarter. Investors will be closely watching the company's gross margin, a key indicator of profitability, which is expected to rise. The report details Nvidia's significant sales surge fueled by demand for processors and the semiconductor shortage, and its expansion into AI, machine learning, and data-center services.

title: Nvidia earnings will be a data-center show, but don’t miss the software on the side stage
summary: Nvidia's upcoming earnings report is expected to heavily feature its data-center sales, with analysts projecting a significant increase. Despite its reputation for chip manufacturing, the article suggests that Nvidia's valuation warrants attention to its software contributions. The company's CEO previously highlighted strong demand for its data-center GPUs.

title: Nvidia earnings will be a data-center show, but don’t miss the software on the side stage
summary: Nvidia's upcoming second-quarter earnings report is expected to heavily feature data-center sales, with analysts predicting a significant rise in server-chip sales. However, the article highlights the increasing importance of Nvidia's software in its overall valuation, suggesting it should be compared more with software companies. While hardware is key, the software supporting Nvidia's graphics processing chips is a critical, often overlooked, aspect of its market position.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang will receive the chip industry's top award
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is being recognized with the Semiconductor Industry Association's prestigious Robert Noyce Award. The award acknowledges Nvidia's significant contributions across gaming, self-driving cars, and scientific computing. Huang will receive the honor at a dinner ceremony in November.

title: NVIDIA maintains dominant position in 2020 market for AI processors for cloud and data center
summary: NVIDIA maintained its dominant position in the 2020 global market for AI processors used in cloud and data centers, holding an 80.6% share of global revenue. The company generated $3.2 billion in cloud and data center AI processor revenue, up from $1.8 billion in 2019, primarily due to its leadership in GPU-derived chips. Omdia predicts that alternative suppliers will gain significant market share in the coming years despite NVIDIA's current advantage.

title: Microchip Technology sees record sales as computer chip supply issues persist
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) reported record-setting sales at the beginning of its 2022 fiscal year, driven by the ongoing global demand for computer chips. CEO Ganesh Moorthy indicated that the entire semiconductor supply chain remains constrained, suggesting that chip shortages will extend into 2022. The company, based in Chandler, is experiencing strong demand amidst an industry-wide supply crunch.

title: U.K. Considers Blocking Nvidia Takeover of Arm Over Security
summary: The U.K. government is reportedly considering blocking Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm Ltd. due to potential national security concerns. This move could complicate Nvidia's push to expand its presence in the semiconductor market through the deal with Japan's SoftBank Group Corp.

title: ANNUAL REPORT 2021 Arm: Business Strategy
summary: Arm's 2021 annual report highlights its business strategy as a leader in semiconductor technology, emphasizing its licensing model and significant investments in R&D since being acquired by SoftBank Group in 2016. The report details how these investments are leading to increasing revenue growth, particularly from 5G smartphone sales and the emerging Arm-based server chip market, despite challenges like the COVID-19 pandemic. It also touches on future growth drivers, including new markets like IoT and autonomous vehicles, and the planned sale of Arm to NVIDIA.
source: ソフトバンクグループ株式会社
source_domain: ソフトバンクグループ株式会社

title: Intel to build Qualcomm chips, aims to catch foundry rivals by 2025
summary: Intel announced its factories will begin building chips for Qualcomm and Amazon, aiming to regain its leadership in chip manufacturing by 2025 against rivals like TSMC and Samsung. The company outlined a new roadmap with five chipmaking technologies and a revised naming scheme to reflect its competitive standing. This move signifies Intel's commitment to overcoming past delays and establishing itself as a leading foundry.

title: Intel CEO Says Chip Shortage Could Stretch Into 2023
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger believes the global semiconductor shortage could extend into 2023, joining a growing consensus that supply chain disruptions will persist. The shortage is impacting various industries, leading to rising prices and production delays for goods ranging from consumer gadgets to automobiles. While some easing is expected later this year, a full return to supply-and-demand balance in the semiconductor industry could take one to two years due to the time required to build manufacturing capacity.

title: Nvidia Stock’s Surge Makes Chip Maker 10th-Biggest U.S. Listed Company
summary: Nvidia Corp. has become the 10th-largest U.S. public company due to a surge in its stock, driven by the post-pandemic boom in the semiconductor business. The company's shares have increased by nearly 80% over the past year, resulting in a market value of approximately $453 billion. This valuation exceeds the combined market capitalization of its rivals Intel Corp. and Broadcom Inc.

title: AEye’s LiDAR to be Available on The NVIDIA DRIVE Autonomous Vehicle Platform
summary: AEye, Inc. announced its adaptive, intelligent LiDAR solutions will be available on the NVIDIA DRIVE autonomous vehicle platform. This collaboration will provide ADAS and AV developers with advanced tools to enhance data quality for Level 2+ to Level 5 autonomous driving applications. Both companies emphasize that intelligence and AI-driven sensing are crucial for developing safer and high-performing autonomous systems.

title: Intel is in talks to buy GlobalFoundries for about $30 billion
summary: Intel is reportedly in discussions to acquire GlobalFoundries for approximately $30 billion, a move that would significantly boost Intel's strategy to become a major contract chip manufacturer. This potential acquisition aligns with Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger's push to expand chip-making capabilities for other companies, a market currently dominated by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. The deal, if it materializes, would be Intel's largest acquisition ever, although GlobalFoundries is also considering an initial public offering.

title: Intel exploring deal to buy US chipmaker GlobalFoundries for $30B
summary: Intel Corp. is reportedly in talks to acquire chipmaker GlobalFoundries Inc. for up to $30 billion, which would be Intel's largest acquisition to date. The potential deal aligns with Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger's strategy to bolster the company's chip production capabilities and compete with industry leaders like TSMC. Analysts note the acquisition could offer immediate benefits to Intel by providing access to more fabs, while GlobalFoundries' owners would secure a significant payday without the uncertainty of an IPO.

title: PTC Collaborates with NVIDIA and NetApp to Launch AI Integration Hub
summary: PTC System (S) Pte Ltd has launched an AI Integration Hub in collaboration with NVIDIA and NetApp to help enterprises leverage AI and data science. The hub is built on NetApp ONTAP AI, combining NVIDIA DGX systems and NetApp All Flash FAS, and aims to accelerate the deployment of AI applications by offering free testing services. This initiative, supported by key executives from PTC, NetApp, and NVIDIA, seeks to boost AI adoption across the Asia-Pacific region, including Singapore, by providing high-performance computing infrastructure and simplified AI deployment paths.

title: Intel Corporation names Shlomit Weiss as co-General Manager of its Design Engineering Group
summary: Shlomit Weiss is returning to Intel as Senior Vice President and co-General Manager of its Design Engineering Group, where she will oversee chip development for client computers. Weiss, who previously spent 28 years at Intel and most recently served as Senior VP for Silicon Engineering at Nvidia, will work from Israel alongside Sunil Shenoy. She brings extensive experience, having been recognized for developing Intel's Dual-Core processor architecture and leading the Sky Lake processor development.

title: Focus: Qualcomm's new CEO eyes dominance in the laptop markets
summary: Qualcomm's new CEO, Cristiano Amon, plans to challenge Apple's dominance in the laptop market by developing energy-efficient chips with the help of former Apple chip architects. The company is also focusing on revenue growth from China for its smartphone chip business despite political tensions and aims to leverage its Nuvia acquisition to push 5G connectivity into laptops, providing custom-designed chips to compete with Apple. Amon also faces the challenge of potentially losing Apple as a modem chip customer and improving Qualcomm's brand recognition among consumers.

title: Advisor Ross Gerber Launches Active 'Roaring '20s' ETF
summary: Advisor Ross Gerber, president and CEO of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth and Investment Management, has launched an actively managed ETF called the AdvisorShares Gerber Kawasaki ETF (GK). This new ETF will focus on nine investment themes Gerber believes will thrive in the post-COVID economy, offering investors access to his stock-picking expertise in a tax-efficient structure. Gerber emphasizes that the ETF is designed as a core growth fund for long-term investors, not a "get-rich-quick" scheme, and aims to provide a smoother ride than more volatile single-theme funds.

title: Texas Instruments to buy semiconductor factory in $900 million deal
summary: Texas Instruments announced it will acquire Micron Technology Inc.'s semiconductor factory in Lehi, Utah, for $900 million in cash. This acquisition will be TI's fourth 300-millimeter wafer facility, strengthening its manufacturing capabilities and supply chain control amid a global chip shortage. The company expects the plant to begin generating revenue in the first quarter of 2023, following an investment of approximately $75 million per quarter in 2022.

title: Nvidia’s takeover of Arm gets support from Broadcom and other chip heavyweights
summary: Broadcom, MediaTek, and Marvell have publicly expressed their support for Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm, despite scrutiny from antitrust regulators and concerns from rivals like Qualcomm, Google, and Microsoft. These chip heavyweights cite assurances from Nvidia regarding increased investment in Arm's technology and continued fair access for the industry. The support comes as Nvidia and Arm CEOs argue the deal is necessary to meet growing demand and accelerate technological roadmaps in the semiconductor industry amidst a global chip shortage.

title: Volvo plans to add lidar as standard equipment in electric XC90 SUV next year
summary: Volvo Cars announced plans to make lidar sensors standard equipment in its electric XC90 SUV starting next year, a strategic move to enhance safety and autonomous driving. This decision positions Volvo differently from rivals like Tesla, which rely solely on cameras. Luminar Technologies Inc. will supply the Iris lidar and Sentinel software for this integration.

title: Unity acquires Pixyz Software
summary: Unity Technologies has acquired France-based Pixyz Software, a specialist in 3D data optimization, for an undisclosed sum. Pixyz's technology, which helps developers import and edit 3D models in real-time, will be integrated into Unity's Create segment, but will continue to charge a separate subscription. This acquisition is part of Unity's strategy to expand its business through targeted takeovers, enhancing its offerings for both gaming and industrial customers.

title: Intel Restructuring: Navin Shenoy Out; New Software, GPU Units
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger has announced a major restructuring of the company, leading to the departure of top data center executive Navin Shenoy. The Data Platform Group is being split into two new business units, and two new divisions, the Software and Advanced Technology Group and the Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics Group, are being formed. These changes aim to accelerate Intel's pace in regaining technology leadership, with new leaders appointed to head the reorganized groups.

title: Longtime Intel exec Navin Shenoy leaves as chipmaker restructures data center business
summary: Longtime Intel executive Navin Shenoy is departing the company as CEO Pat Gelsinger implements a major restructuring of its critical data center business, creating two new units. The Data Platform Group is being split into a Datacenter and AI group led by Sandra Rivera, and a Network and Edge Group led by Nick McKeown. Additionally, Intel is forming a Software and Advanced Technology Group and an Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics Group, led by Greg Lavender and Raja Koduri respectively, to better compete with rivals like Nvidia, Arm Ltd., Qualcomm Corp., and Advanced Micro Devices Inc.

title: Bernstein recommends Sea, says Singapore-based internet company is a 'super app in the making'
summary: Bernstein recommends Sea Ltd., calling the Singapore-based internet company a "super app in the making" and initiating coverage with an outperform rating and a $350 price target. The investment firm believes Sea's strong execution track record ensures its dominance in various verticals, particularly highlighting the potential of its e-commerce arm, Shopee, to reach breakeven by 2025. Key drivers for the stock are expected to be Shopee's expansion in Latin America and grocery in Southeast Asia, leading to increased profitability.

title: Invest in ETFs
summary: VanEck offers a variety of ETFs covering timeless themes like global equity, gold miners, and real estate, as well as smart themes such as semiconductors, video gaming, esports, and hydrogen. Each ETF is designed to support different investment goals but comes with specific risks that investors should carefully assess against their individual objectives. The article emphasizes conducting due diligence by referring to relevant documentation like the prospectus and Key Information Document (KID) before investing.

title: NVIDIA to Acquire DeepMap, Enhancing Mapping Solutions for the AV Industry
summary: NVIDIA has acquired DeepMap, a startup focused on creating high-definition maps for autonomous vehicles, to enhance its mapping products and accelerate full self-driving expertise. DeepMap's technology provides centimeter-level precision mapping and continuous updates, crucial for autonomous vehicles to navigate safely and accurately. This acquisition strengthens NVIDIA's DRIVE platform by improving localization capabilities for AVs.

title: Opinion: AMD’s stock has been left behind, but not for long — here’s why
summary: The article argues that Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is a good buy despite its significant past gains, as it hasn't fully rebounded from a recent dip unlike other semiconductor stocks like Nvidia. The author attributes this potential for future growth to AMD's new cutting-edge products and a key acquisition.

title: New Cadence Allegro X Design Platform Revolutionizes System Design
summary: Cadence Design Systems introduces the Allegro X Design Platform, an integrated engineering solution for system design that unifies schematic, layout, analysis, collaboration, and data management. This new platform, built on Allegro and OrCAD technology, aims to significantly streamline the design process for engineers, offering up to 4X productivity improvements through enhanced integration, cloud capabilities, and ML-driven advancements. It supports complex multi-domain designs (EM, thermal, SI/PI) and leverages GPU technology for accelerated performance.

title: AMD extends FidelityFX Super Resolution to RX 470 and RX 480
summary: AMD is extending its FidelityFX Super Resolution (FSR) technology to older graphics cards, specifically the Radeon RX 470 and RX 480 GPUs, dating back to 2016. This digital upscaling technology is designed to improve game performance and visuals without requiring significant processing power, and it will also work with a wide range of other AMD and some NVIDIA GeForce cards. FSR is expected to launch on June 22, 2021, offering performance boosts for both high-end and older hardware.

title: People camped out at Bakersfield Best Buy for upcoming graphics card
summary: Nearly one hundred people camped out at the Bakersfield Best Buy on Rosedale Highway for NVIDIA’s latest graphics card, the GeForce RTX 3080 Ti Founders Edition. The card was set to be released on Thursday at select Best Buy stores nationwide, with customers lining up due to global chip shortages and high demand. Employees planned to hand out tickets at 7:30 a.m., guaranteeing purchase at 9 a.m. for those who received one.

title: AMD shows how FidelityFX Super Resolution beats out NVIDIA's DLSS
summary: AMD announced FidelityFX Super Resolution (FSR) at Computex 2021, an image upscaling technology designed to boost frame rates and resolution. FSR directly competes with NVIDIA's DLSS but offers broader compatibility, supporting a wide range of AMD GPUs and even some NVIDIA GeForce cards. The technology, which provides up to a 2.5 times increase in performance mode, is expected to launch on June 22, 2021.

title: How Nvidia plans to own the data center with AI
summary: Nvidia aims to revolutionize enterprise computing by making data centers run 10 times faster at one-tenth the cost, leveraging its strong position in AI architectures. The company plans to disrupt Intel's x86 dominance through Arm-based architectures, integrated chip designs, and a compelling software consumption model. The article highlights Nvidia's strategic moves, financial standing, and the potential impact of its proposed acquisition of Arm Ltd. on the data center market.

title: Stock of the week - NVIDIA (27.05.2021)
summary: NVIDIA (NVDA.US) reported record first-quarter fiscal 2022 results, exceeding revenue and EPS expectations, driven by strong performance in Gaming, Data Center, and Professional Visualization platforms. The company also announced an upbeat Q2 forecast and a 4-for-1 stock split, which is seen as a bullish signal for investors. The growth is significantly boosted by the gaming sector during the pandemic and the increasing demand for its graphics cards by cryptocurrency miners.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for First Quarter Fiscal 2022
summary: NVIDIA reported record revenue of $5.66 billion for the first quarter of fiscal 2022, an 84% increase year-over-year, driven by strong growth in its Gaming and Data Center platforms. The company also announced a four-for-one stock split and provided an optimistic outlook for the second quarter, projecting revenue of $6.30 billion. Key highlights include advancements in Gaming with new RTX GPUs and DLSS adoption, and significant innovations in Data Center and Automotive sectors.

title: SOXX Versus SOXL Semiconductor ETF Forecast: Which Is a Better Buy?
summary: This article compares two semiconductor ETFs, SOXX and SOXL, to determine which might be a better investment. SOXL is a leveraged ETF offering 3x daily returns, leading to higher performance during bull markets but also higher risk. SOXX is a plain ETF for risk-averse, long-term investors, with both ETFs holding similar top companies and having a positive medium-term outlook despite the cyclical nature of the industry.

title: Putting the Chip Shortage into the Context of Long-Term Trends
summary: The article analyzes the current global semiconductor shortage, attributing it to supply chain rigidities, high barriers to entry, and geopolitical tensions exacerbated by COVID-19. It highlights the long-term trends driving increased semiconductor demand, such as 5G, AI, and electric vehicles, and discusses how governments and companies are responding to secure future supply chains and potentially re-shore manufacturing.

title: NVIDIA Announces Four-for-One Stock Split, Pending Stockholder Approval at Annual Meeting Set for June 3
summary: NVIDIA announced a four-for-one stock split in the form of a stock dividend, pending stockholder approval at its annual meeting on June 3. The split aims to make stock ownership more accessible to investors and employees. If approved, stockholders of record on June 21, 2021, will receive three additional shares for every share held, with trading on a split-adjusted basis expected to begin on July 20.

title: Nvidia sets 4-for-1 stock split, shares rise
summary: Nvidia Corp announced a four-for-one stock split to make its shares more affordable for investors, causing its stock to rise by 3%. This move follows similar splits by Apple and Tesla last year, with Nvidia's split requiring stockholder approval in June and effective mid-July.

title: Insiders reveal one big surprise about a rumored OLED Nintendo Switch Pro
summary: Rumors suggest an OLED Nintendo Switch Pro is in the works, with industry insiders weighing in on what an OLED screen and a more powerful CPU could mean for the new console. While some believe an OLED screen is a natural evolution and won't significantly impact price, others see it and a new CPU as major upgrades that will improve the handheld experience. The article highlights the speculative nature of these discussions, despite enthusiasm from fans.

title: Redwood City startup Mythic scores $70M to challenge Nvidia on AI chips
summary: Redwood City-based startup Mythic has successfully raised $70 million to further develop its AI chips, positioning itself to challenge market leader Nvidia. Mythic is part of a new wave of semiconductor companies aiming to create chips that outperform existing options for AI tasks. This funding round highlights increasing competition in the AI chip market.

title: STMicroelectronics Tackles the EV Industry with GaN
summary: STMicroelectronics is focusing on gallium nitride (GaN) technology to enhance efficiency in electric vehicle applications, recognizing its superiority over silicon in high-power scenarios. The company has released a new family of GaN devices called STi2GaN, specifically designed for the automotive industry, which integrates power stages, drivers, and protection within GaN and SiP solutions. This move aligns with STMicroelectronics' earlier commitment to invest in wide-bandgap semiconductors for carbon neutrality goals.

title: Apple’s new M1 chip creates a competitive advantage
summary: Apple has introduced new iMacs and iPad Pros featuring its M1 chip, allowing the company to control its entire technology stack and gain a competitive advantage. This strategy insulates Apple from the global chip shortage affecting other manufacturers reliant on third-party semiconductors. Experts like Richard Barnett highlight that Apple's approach contrasts sharply with the challenges faced by automotive, consumer electronics, and medical device industries.

title: Crypto ETF | Invest in the Crypto Revolution
summary: VanEck offers a Crypto ETF (VanEck Blockchain and Crypto Innovators UCITS ETF) designed for investors looking to gain diversified exposure to the rapidly growing blockchain ecosystem. This ETF provides a pure-play approach by investing in companies driving the crypto evolution across various sectors like payment gateways, hardware, exchanges, crypto miners, and blockchain services. The article details the ETF's specifications, rationale for investing, and potential risks associated with the asset class.

title: Intel vs Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
summary: This article analyzes the long-standing rivalry between Intel and AMD, comparing their historical market dominance, recent performance, financial health, and future outlook. It highlights AMD's recent surge due to TSMC's advanced chip manufacturing, challenging Intel's traditional leadership. The author concludes by positioning AMD as a growth play and Intel as a value play, considering potential comebacks and ongoing industry challenges like chip shortages.

title: Arm details new data center chips, says Oracle, Alibaba will use them
summary: Arm Ltd revealed new details about its next-generation data center technology, with its "N2" Neoverse computing cores expected to be about 40% faster and "V1" cores 50% faster than previous methods for AI tasks. Oracle Corp and Alibaba Group Holding are set to use these new Arm-based chips, signaling a growing push into the data center processor market long dominated by Intel and AMD. This move is seen as crucial for Nvidia Corp's $40 billion acquisition of Arm, which is currently under national security review.

title: Data processing units accelerate infrastructure performance
summary: Data processing units (DPUs) are emerging as a critical technology in data centers, offloading networking and communication tasks from CPUs to enhance infrastructure performance. This article explains how DPUs work, highlights key vendors like Fungible, Nvidia, AWS, and Nebulon, and discusses their role in software-defined infrastructure and future enterprise adoption.

title: NVIDIA Partners with Schrödinger to Further Accelerate Drug Discovery Worldwide
summary: NVIDIA is partnering with Schrödinger to accelerate drug discovery by integrating Schrödinger's computational platform with NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD systems and NVIDIA Clara Discovery. This collaboration aims to enhance the speed and accuracy of evaluating billions of molecules for therapeutics, making advanced drug discovery tools accessible to the entire pharmaceutical industry, from startups to multinational corporations. The initiative will leverage NVIDIA's GPU technology to optimize Schrödinger's physics-based modeling and machine learning capabilities.

title: NVIDIA Announces CPU for Giant AI and High Performance Computing Workloads
summary: NVIDIA has announced its first data center CPU, Grace, an Arm-based processor designed to deliver 10x the performance of today’s fastest servers for complex AI and high-performance computing workloads. This specialized processor targets advanced applications with enormous datasets and massive memory requirements, making NVIDIA a "three-chip company" alongside its GPUs and DPUs. The Swiss National Supercomputing Centre and Los Alamos National Laboratory are among the first to plan Grace-powered supercomputers, expected online in 2023.

title: NVIDIA and Global Computer Makers Launch Industry-Standard Enterprise Server Platforms for AI
summary: NVIDIA introduced new NVIDIA-Certified Systems designed to bring AI capabilities to organizations using industry-standard enterprise data center infrastructure. These systems, featuring NVIDIA AI Enterprise software certified for VMware vSphere 7, allow businesses to run virtualized AI applications on existing servers. The launch includes new NVIDIA A30 and A10 GPUs to support mainstream AI and graphics workloads, with computer makers like Atos, Dell Technologies, and Supermicro offering these NVIDIA EGX platform-enabled servers.

title: Swiss National Supercomputing Centre, Hewlett Packard Enterprise and NVIDIA Announce World’s Most Powerful AI-Capable Supercomputer
summary: The Swiss National Supercomputing Centre (CSCS), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), and NVIDIA announced the creation of "Alps," which is expected to be the world's most powerful AI-capable supercomputer when it comes online in 2023. This system will replace CSCS’s existing Piz Daint supercomputer and serve a broad community of researchers, offering 7x faster AI capabilities than current leading systems. Alps will be built by HPE using the new HPE Cray EX supercomputer product line, featuring NVIDIA HGX supercomputing platform including NVIDIA GPUs and the new Arm-based NVIDIA Grace CPU, enabling breakthrough research across various scientific fields.

title: Nvidia to directly challenge Intel with Arm-based 'Grace' server chip
summary: Nvidia Corp announced its plan to develop an Arm-based server processor chip called "Grace," directly challenging Intel in the data center market. This move intensifies competition with Intel and adds complexity to the antitrust review of Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm. The new server chip, expected in 2023, is designed for artificial intelligence algorithms, further solidifying Nvidia's focus on AI computing.

title: Nvidia steps up competition with Intel and AMD with first data-center CPU, based on Arm
summary: Nvidia introduced its first data-center CPU, named Grace, which is based on Arm technology, intensifying its competition with Intel and AMD in the artificial-intelligence market. This move comes as Nvidia awaits approval for its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Holdings PLC, demonstrating its strategy for future AI business. The new CPU bundle for servers enters a market traditionally dominated by Intel and AMD.

title: Nvidia steps up competition with Intel and AMD with first data-center CPU, based on Arm
summary: Nvidia introduced its first data-center CPU, named Grace, which is based on Arm technology, intensifying its competition with Intel and AMD in the artificial intelligence and data-center market.
