It highlights diverse topics including cybersecurity rivalries with Nir Zuk, diamond creation with Benny Landa, a universal flu vaccine from BiondVax, research into mortality by Yair Dor-Ziderman, bio-hacking, Alzheimer's research, insights into white supremacy, and the Mellanox acquisition by Nvidia.

title: Arbe raises $32M to bring high-res radar for autonomous vehicles to market
summary: Arbe Robotics Ltd. has successfully closed a $32 million Series B funding round to advance the production of its 4D imaging radar chipset for autonomous vehicles. The company's technology offers significantly more detailed imaging and aims to provide an affordable, lidar-free solution for Level 3 autonomy in all weather conditions. This investment will enable Arbe to expand its team and supply its proprietary radar chipset to global automotive manufacturers.

title: Nvidia debuts new DRIVE AGX Orin platform for autonomous cars and robots
summary: Nvidia has launched its new DRIVE AGX Orin platform, designed to power AI systems in autonomous vehicles and robots. The platform features the Orin system-on-a-chip, boasting 17 billion transistors and capable of 200 trillion operations per second, making it seven times faster than its predecessor. Didi Chuxing is already utilizing the platform for its Level 4 autonomous driving development, and Nvidia is offering free access to its DRIVE deep neural networks to other transportation industry customers to encourage adoption.

title: NVIDIA Introduces DRIVE AGX Orin — Advanced, Software-Defined Platform for Autonomous Machines
summary: NVIDIA has unveiled DRIVE AGX Orin, a sophisticated software-defined platform for autonomous vehicles and robots, powered by the new Orin SoC. This system-on-a-chip boasts 17 billion transistors and delivers 200 trillion operations per second, a sevenfold increase over its predecessor, Xavier. Designed for scalability from Level 2 to Level 5 autonomous driving, the platform aims to meet the computing challenges of safe autonomous technology and is slated for automakers' 2022 production timelines.

title: Here are the best-performing stocks of the decade
summary: This article highlights the top-performing stocks of the decade, with Netflix leading the pack with a 3,726.2% return. Other significant performers include semiconductor companies Broadcom and Nvidia, electronic bond trading platform MarketAxess, and Domino's Pizza, which experienced a remarkable turnaround. The article also touches on other companies like Neurocrine Biosciences, Exact Sciences, Cheniere Energy, and DexCom, emphasizing themes of disruption, technological innovation, and strategic business changes that fueled these impressive gains over the last ten years.

title: Which groups earn the most at Intel? Company offers peek at pay data other tech firms won’t show
summary: Intel released compensation data for its U.S. employees from 2017 and 2018, revealing that white and Asian males were the highest earners in most occupation categories. The company, which is transparent about its diversity efforts, aims to encourage other tech firms to share similar data. This disclosure comes as the EEOC for the first time required companies to include pay data.

title: HKSTP and UMEC Organise First AI Chips Summit
summary: The Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP) and United Microelectronics Centre (UMEC) jointly organized the first AI Chips Summit to promote the development of an Artificial Intelligence hardware ecosystem. The summit brought together global technology experts, industry players, academics, and Park company representatives to discuss advanced machine learning-based design methodologies and tools for AI chips and accelerators. HKSTP emphasized its ongoing efforts to support AI and innovative technology development through initiatives like iDM 2 Micro-Electronics Node and AI Plug@HKSTP.
source: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP)
source_domain: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP)

title: Intel in talks to buy Israeli AI chip co Habana Labs
summary: Intel is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Israeli AI chip startup Habana Labs for an estimated $1 billion. Habana Labs, founded in 2016, previously raised $120 million, with Intel Capital leading its latest financing round in November 2018. If the acquisition proceeds, it would significantly strengthen Intel's position in the AI chip market, where Habana Labs has developed specialized AI Training and Inference Processors.

title: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X review: Amazing multi-core CPU performance at an unbelievable price
summary: This article reviews the AMD Ryzen 9 3900X, highlighting its exceptional multi-core performance and competitive pricing which allows it to challenge Intel's high-end offerings. The review emphasizes the CPU's 12 cores, 24 threads, PCIe 4.0 support, and AM4 compatibility, positioning it as a strong contender for demanding tasks like video editing and gaming. It concludes that the Ryzen 9 3900X offers incredible value and performance, making the desktop CPU market more competitive and beneficial for consumers.

title: “BOTZ” ETF Gives Investors Worldwide Exposure to Robotics and AI
summary: The Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence Thematic ETF (BOTZ) provides investors with exposure to companies benefiting from the increased adoption of robotics and AI across various sectors and geographies. The article highlights how robotics can address labor shortages, particularly in manufacturing, by presenting examples of cost savings and improved efficiency. BOTZ aims to track the Indxx Global Robotics & Artificial Intelligence Thematic Index, offering high growth potential and efficient access to dozens of relevant companies through a single trade.

title: Intel Speeds AI Development, Deployment and Performance with New Class of AI Hardware from Cloud to Edge
summary: Intel announced new AI hardware, including the Intel Nervana Neural Network Processors (NNP-T1000 and NNP-I1000) for training and inference, and its next-generation Intel Movidius Myriad Vision Processing Unit (VPU). These products are designed to accelerate AI development and deployment from cloud to edge, further strengthening Intel's AI solutions portfolio, which is expected to generate over $3.5 billion in revenue in 2019. The company also introduced the Intel DevCloud for the Edge to help developers prototype AI solutions on Intel processors.

title: Microsoft tops list of the most ‘just’ US corporations
summary: Microsoft Corp. has topped the list of America's Most JUST Companies for the second consecutive year, recognized for its commitment to workers, communities, and the environment. The nonprofit JUST Capital's rankings highlight corporations that prioritize all stakeholders, not just shareholders, addressing concerns about wealth inequality and climate change. The study analyzed 922 companies on issues like fair wages, environmental protection, and ethical business practices, with tech companies like NVIDIA and Apple also ranking high.

title: Microsoft Net Income by Year: FY 1990 - 2021
summary: This article analyzes Microsoft's annual net income from fiscal year 1990 to 2021, highlighting key financial milestones and significant changes in its profitability. It details the company's highest-ever annual net profit in FY 2020 and discusses factors behind fluctuations in other fiscal years, such as tax payments and acquisitions. The article also provides a brief overview of Microsoft's history and major corporate moves.

title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang named top-performing CEO of 2019
summary: Nvidia Corp. co-founder and CEO Jensen Huang has been named the No. 1 top-performing CEO globally by Harvard Business Review for his 26 years at the helm and the significant rise in the company's stock price. The article highlights Huang's achievement and briefly mentions other Bay Area CEOs who also ranked. It also lists related articles concerning Bay Area tech and executive news.

title: Value investing: A deep dive into performance
summary: This article analyzes the significant underperformance of value investing compared to growth investing over the past decade, especially through 2019, contrasting it with the dot-com bubble's aftermath. It examines historical returns, allocation data, and sector weightings (overweighting financials and energy for value; underweighting technology and healthcare), highlighting how these factors contributed to the disparity. The report is part one of a three-part series dissecting value funds' underperformance.

title: Future of Streaming Entertainment Starts Today with Launch of NVIDIA SHIELD TV, Starting at $149
summary: NVIDIA has launched its next generation of SHIELD TV, starting at $149, comprising two new models: SHIELD TV and SHIELD TV Pro. These devices feature the new Tegra X1+ processor, delivering 25% more performance, and support Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos for enhanced visual and audio experiences. The new SHIELD models also utilize AI upscaling for HD content to 4K resolution and offer access to a wide range of streaming, gaming, and AI capabilities.

title: Bull ‘trend’ intact, S&P 500 inches toward record territory
summary: The U.S. benchmarks' overall bullish trend remains intact and is strengthening, especially after constructive October price action. The S&P 500 is nearing record territory. This article is a free edition of The Technical Indicator, a daily MarketWatch subscriber newsletter.

title: Bull ‘trend’ intact, S&P 500 inches toward record territory
summary: The article indicates that the bull trend for the S&P 500 remains intact and is strengthening, with the index nearing record territory. This positive outlook is supported by constructive price action observed in October. The content is presented as a free edition of "The Technical Indicator" newsletter from MarketWatch.

title: NVIDIA with Microsoft Announces Technology Collaboration for Era of Intelligent Edge
summary: NVIDIA and Microsoft have announced a technology collaboration focused on intelligent edge computing to help industries manage and gain insights from vast amounts of data. This partnership integrates Microsoft Azure with the NVIDIA EGX platform and NVIDIA T4 GPUs to accelerate AI capabilities from the edge to the cloud. The collaboration aims to enable breakthrough experiences for customers across various industries, including retail, manufacturing, and smart cities.

title: Inception Spotlight: Subtle Medical’s AI-based Medical Imaging Software Receives FDA Clearance
summary: Subtle Medical, an NVIDIA Inception member, secured FDA clearance for its AI-based SubtleMR imaging processing software. This technology uses deep learning to denoise medical images from existing MRI scanners, integrating into radiology workflows to improve patient experience and operational efficiency. The software leverages NVIDIA's hardware and software, including DGX Station, DGX-1, and T4s, achieving significant speedups with TensorRT.

title: Semiconductor stocks are poised to benefit as industry sales growth resumes in 2020
summary: Semiconductor stocks, though volatile, are expected to see sales growth resume in 2020 after a "reset" year in 2019. The industry has been significantly impacted by the U.S.-China trade conflict. Analysts anticipate Nvidia's sales to decline by 6% this year but rebound with 17% growth in 2020.

title: Semiconductor stocks are poised to benefit as industry sales growth resumes in 2020
summary: Semiconductor stocks are expected to see a rebound in sales growth in 2020, following a "reset" year in 2019. Despite volatility, these stocks have historically been strong long-term investments. The industry, significantly impacted by U.S.-China trade tensions, anticipates a return to growth with companies like Nvidia projected to see a 17% sales increase next year.

title: Semiconductor stocks are poised to benefit as industry sales growth resumes in 2020
summary: Analysts are predicting a rebound in the semiconductor industry in 2020, with sales growth resuming after a "reset" year in 2019. Despite the volatility and impact from the U.S.-China trade conflict, semiconductor stocks are seen as good long-term investments. For example, Nvidia's sales are expected to decline 6% in 2019 but grow 17% in 2020.

title: Semiconductor stocks are poised to benefit as industry sales growth resumes in 2020
summary: Semiconductor stocks are expected to see a rebound in sales growth in 2020 after a challenging 2019, which is considered a "reset" year. Despite their volatility, these stocks have historically been excellent long-term investments. The industry has been particularly affected by the U.S.-China trade conflict, but analysts project a significant sales increase for companies like Nvidia next year.

title: Apple says Mac Pro manufacturing will remain in Austin
summary: Apple announced on Monday that it will continue manufacturing its Mac Pro computers in Austin, Texas, reversing earlier reports of a potential move to China. This decision comes after the company secured tariff exemptions from the U.S. government for key imported parts, allowing it to avoid additional costs. Apple (AAPL) emphasized its commitment to U.S. manufacturing and its significant investment in the American economy, including its operations and planned expansion in Austin.

title: Avantis U.S. Equity ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NYSEARCA:AVUS)
summary: The Avantis U.S. Equity ETF (AVUS) is an exchange-traded fund that tracks the Russell 3000 index, launched on September 24, 2019, and managed by American Century Investments. It features a diversified portfolio of US equities with a bias towards smaller, more profitable, or value companies. As of January 9, 2026, AVUS was trading at $115.05, with $10.80 billion in assets under management and a net expense ratio of 0.15%.

title: The highest-paying company in 2019 pays a median salary of $170,929 — here are 9 other companies that pay the most
summary: Glassdoor compiled a list of the 25 highest-paying companies in 2019, with a focus on the top 10. These companies, primarily in tech, consulting, and finance, offer median employee salaries of $148,000 or above. Palo Alto Networks leads the list with a median staff salary of $170,929.

title: You might have never heard of America's top-paying company
summary: Palo Alto Networks, a cybersecurity company, has been identified as America's highest-paying company in Glassdoor's latest ranking, offering a median total pay of nearly $171,000 annually. This figure surpasses well-known tech giants like Facebook, Google, and Microsoft. The company's focus on a growing industry—cybersecurity and cloud services—contributes to its high demand for talent and generous compensation.

title: Pure Storage Goes Wide On Flash: Intros Optane-Based Modules For Performance, QLC For Capacity
summary: Pure Storage expanded its all-flash storage array line with two key innovations: DirectMemory Modules for high-performance applications using Intel Optane and QLC-based FlashArray//C for capacity-optimized, more economical all-flash storage. These introductions aim to broaden Pure Storage's market reach by addressing both extreme performance needs and the demand for cost-effective, high-capacity flash solutions, making the all-flash data center more economically viable. The new offerings are designed to provide significant performance boosts and consolidate large-scale tier-two data, respectively.

title: Nvidia’s TensorRT deep learning inference platform breaks new ground in conversational AI
summary: Nvidia has released a new version of its TensorRT deep learning inference platform, significantly improving performance for conversational AI. TensorRT 6 reduces inference times for BERT-Large to 5.8 milliseconds, making it practical for enterprise deployment. The platform also includes optimizations for speech recognition, 3D image segmentation, and industrial automation applications, while also enhancing support for dynamic input batch sizes.

title: Taking a Look Under the Hood of VanEck’s Video Gaming and Esports ETF
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at the holdings within VanEck's Video Gaming and Esports ETF (ESPO), highlighting key companies from both Asia-Pacific and the U.S. It discusses the performance and business models of leading firms like Sea Limited, Bandai Namco, Square Enix, Advanced Micro Devices, Zynga, and Activision Blizzard. The article suggests that investing in a diversified ETF can offer targeted exposure to the high-growth video gaming and esports sector.

title: NVIDIA Quadro RTX 6000 Powers World’s Fastest Laptop — ASUS ProArt StudioBook One
summary: NVIDIA announced that the Quadro RTX 6000 GPU will power the ASUS ProArt StudioBook One, hailed as the world's most powerful laptop. This new system joins 11 other RTX Studio systems, bringing the total to 39, and is designed for creative professionals needing high-end workstation performance on the go. The laptop features 24GB of GPU memory, real-time ray tracing, and advanced thermal cooling, supporting demanding workflows like 3D animation, 8K video editing, and VR.

title: 5G Technology Making Its Way Into Self-Driving Cars
summary: 5G technology, specifically C-V2X, is set to revolutionize self-driving cars by enabling vehicles to communicate wirelessly for improved functionality and safety. Investors can capitalize on this emerging trend through ETFs like the iShares Self-Driving EV and Tech ETF (IDRV), which provides exposure to companies involved in self-driving and electric vehicle innovation. The article highlights the disruptive potential of 5G in various industries beyond just autonomous driving.

title: HP Announces CEO Is Suddenly Stepping Down, Stock Plunges Amid Mixed Earnings
summary: HP Inc. announced that CEO Dion Weisler is stepping down due to a family health issue, leading to a stock plunge despite mixed Q3 earnings that beat EPS but missed slightly on revenue. Enrique Lores, a long-time HP veteran, will succeed Weisler, who was instrumental in the company's cybersecurity focus. The change comes as HP aims to strengthen its position in the competitive PC market.

title: Nvidia jumps on earnings beat
summary: Nvidia's stock rose after reporting better-than-expected fiscal second-quarter earnings, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and earnings per share. Despite an annualized revenue decline of 17%, driven by decreases in gaming and data center segments, the company offered optimistic guidance for the third quarter's gross margin. Analysts noted a potential return to normalcy in the second half of 2019, citing strong market positioning for Nvidia's GPUs.

title: KeyShot 9 to support GPU rendering through Nvidia RTX ray tracing and AI denoising
summary: Luxion has announced that KeyShot 9, set for release in Autumn, will incorporate Nvidia RTX ray tracing and AI denoising for GPU rendering. This marks a significant shift as KeyShot has traditionally relied on CPU-based ray tracing, but Luxion emphasizes that users will have seamless control and choice between CPU and GPU rendering workflows. Supported graphics cards include Nvidia GeForce, Quadro, and Tesla products with Maxwell and newer generation GPUs.

title: IOTA DLT integrated with major manufacturer STMicroelectronics
summary: The IOTA Foundation announced a partnership with STMicroelectronics to integrate its DLT (directed acyclic graph or tangle) technology with ST's electronic devices, enabling immediate access to the tangle for users of ST components. This collaboration aims to advance IoT technology by providing a scalable and fee-free blockchain solution for connected smart devices. STMicroelectronics, with a market cap of $15.8 billion, is a major electronics firm producing sensors and semiconductors for a vast global client base.

title: Rekor joins Nvidia’s Metropolis Software Partner Program
summary: Rekor Systems Inc has joined the Nvidia Metropolis Software Partner Program, using Nvidia GPUs to accelerate its OpenALPR vehicle recognition software. The Metropolis platform leverages AI for smarter cities, enabling Rekor's software to accurately scan and recognize license plates, vehicle details, and support applications like law enforcement and traffic management. This collaboration enhances OpenALPR's speed, accuracy, and scalability, reducing hardware costs for customers.

title: Nvidia responds to AMD with ‘Super’ gaming cards
summary: Nvidia has launched a new "Super" brand line of its RTX Turing-based gaming cards in response to rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc. The new cards, which allow real-time ray tracing, include the RTX 2060 Super, RTX 2070 Super, and RTX 2080 Super, with release dates scheduled throughout July. An analyst suggests Nvidia's marketing of these chips will be crucial in fending off AMD's challenge.

title: ‘Quake II RTX,’ NVIDIA’s Reimagining of PC Gaming Classic with Ray-Traced Graphics, Available Now
summary: NVIDIA announced the release of 'Quake II RTX,' a fully path-traced version of the classic PC game, available now as a free download on Steam and nvidia.com. This title is the world's first game to be fully path-traced, unifying all lighting effects into a single ray-tracing algorithm. The release includes the first three single-player levels, with the full game, including multiplayer, available for existing Quake II owners with the RTX upgrade.

title: DEEP FOCUS: Understanding Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock
summary: This article provides a deep dive into Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock, analyzing its market position, competition, product segments, financial trends, and cash flow situation. It highlights AMD's stock performance, its rivalry with Intel, and the anticipated impact of new product launches on its future growth and market share amidst the US-China trade war concerns.

title: With Cray Deal, HPE Finally Enters The HPC Big Leagues
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is acquiring supercomputer maker Cray for $1.3 billion, net of Cray's cash, strategically positioning HPE in the high-performance computing (HPC) sector. This acquisition allows HPE to leverage Cray's exascale system wins and Slingshot interconnect technology, while providing Cray with the financial heft and market reach of a larger company. The deal is expected to solidify HPE's competitive standing against rivals like Dell and IBM in the HPC market.

title: India's leading gaming company receives NVIDIA Certification
summary: CIRCLE Gaming, an Indian gaming peripherals manufacturer and cafe operator, has received NVIDIA certification. This recognition highlights CIRCLE Gaming's growth and business acumen, expanding from one cafe to over thirty in three years. NVIDIA views this as a step towards creating a world-class gaming ecosystem in India, recognizing CIRCLE Gaming's success in integrating product and industry expertise in the cafe business.

title: Release! CORSAIR ONE i140/i160, small size of 12L
summary: Lynx International Inc. has launched the CORSAIR ONE i140 and CORSAIR ONE i160 compact gaming desktop PCs in Japan. These computers feature a small 12L body while packing high-spec components like Intel Core processors and NVIDIA GeForce RTX GPUs, alongside advanced cooling solutions for stable operation. The CORSAIR ONE i140 is priced at 399,800 JPY and the i160 at 479,800 JPY, both released on May 11, 2019.

title: Using HashiCorp Nomad to Schedule GPU Workloads | NVIDIA Technical Blog
summary: HashiCorp Nomad 0.9 introduces device plugins, including one for NVIDIA GPUs, allowing Nomad clients to detect, fingerprint, and make hardware devices available for scheduling workloads. This feature enables users to specify GPU requirements like count, memory, and model type in job specifications, optimizing task placement for GPU-accelerated applications. The article demonstrates how this integration supports deep learning inference applications using NVIDIA's TensorRT Inference Server on a GPU-enabled Nomad cluster.

title: Investors Sue to Block Mellanox-Nvidia Deal, Report Says
summary: A shareholder of Mellanox Technologies Ltd. has filed a class-action lawsuit to block the company's acquisition by Nvidia Corp. for $6.9 billion. The suit alleges that Mellanox failed to provide sufficient information to the SEC regarding Nvidia's bid and criticized JP Morgan's analysis of the deal. The transaction, announced in March, is expected to be completed later this year.

title: AMD's 50th Anniversary Reminds Us Why The Company Matters
summary: This article reflects on AMD's 50th anniversary, highlighting its resilience, innovation, and historical milestones under various leaders, currently Lisa Su. The author, a long-time observer of AMD, discusses the company's evolution from its founding in 1969 to its current focus on high-performance computing, emphasizing its commitment to execution and a people-centric culture. The piece celebrates AMD's ability to consistently bounce back from challenges and its vision for future technological innovation.

title: Intel roadmaps leak showing company's plans through 2021 - CPU - News
summary: Purported Intel mobile and desktop processor roadmaps have leaked, reportedly from a Dell presentation, detailing plans through Q4 2021. The roadmaps show the introduction of Comet Lake H series processors (14nm) and Ice Lake U (10nm) for mobile, and similar 14nm Comet Lake H and speculative 10nm Rocket Lake processors for desktops, indicating a slower transition to 10nm than previously anticipated by some.

title: Xpeng Motors debuts at Auto Shanghai 2019, premiering the Xpeng P7 intelligent electric coupe
summary: Xpeng Motors unveiled its new production model, the P7 intelligent electric coupe, at Auto Shanghai 2019. The P7 boasts a 4s-to-100km/h acceleration, 600 km+ NEDC range, and a Level 3-ready autonomous driving platform. It combines NVIDIA DRIVE Xavier and Qualcomm Snapdragon 820A processors, and features Xpeng's XPILOT 3.0 autonomous driving system tailored for China's road conditions.

title: Qualcomm aims to take on Nvidia, Intel with new AI chips
summary: Qualcomm is entering the artificial intelligence chip market with its new Cloud AI 100 chip, aiming to compete with Nvidia and Intel. The company plans to target smaller, simpler data centers with power-efficient chips designed for "inference" tasks, leveraging its expertise from mobile phone chip development. Testing with partners like Microsoft is expected to begin later this year, with mass production in 2020.

title: Qualcomm Announces New AI Chip for Cloud Data Center Servers
summary: Qualcomm Inc., a leader in smartphone technology, is entering the crowded market for AI chips used in cloud data centers. The company plans to leverage its mobile expertise and advanced manufacturing to deliver power-efficient products, aiming for a share of a market projected to reach $17 billion by 2025. This move positions Qualcomm to compete with established players like Intel, Nvidia, and cloud providers already developing AI components.

title: Ushering in a new wave of video surveillance capabilities
summary: Next-generation IP cameras, powered by advanced AI-enabled chips, are revolutionizing video surveillance by processing data at the edge, offering real-time analytics for professional and consumer markets. This on-device processing enhances privacy, reduces network and storage costs, and enables faster reaction times for critical events. The technology is set to impact retail, smart cities, and home monitoring by providing valuable insights and improved security.

title: NVIDIA Is A Data Center Company Now
summary: NVIDIA's acquisition of Mellanox for $6.9 billion signifies its strategic shift from primarily a GPU company to a full-fledged data center company. This move leverages NVIDIA's success in High-Performance Compute (HPC) and AI with GPUs, integrating Mellanox's data center networking expertise to address the growing demands of data science and hyperscale workloads. The article highlights how NVIDIA is expanding its ecosystem to support diverse data center needs, from specialized accelerators to broader infrastructure solutions.

title: Nvidia CEO: Every Big Company Wants To Be In Israel Today
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated during a visit to Israel that every major company desires a presence in the country, highlighting strong foreign investment in its high-tech sector. His visit followed Nvidia's $6.9 billion acquisition of Israeli company Mellanox Technologies, a move that will make Israel Nvidia's second-largest employee base. Nvidia plans to continue investing in Israel's technology talent and excellence, recognizing the country as a crucial global tech hub.

title: Mellanox to stay independent within Nvidia with Waldman at its head, CEO says
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced that Mellanox Technologies Ltd., following its $6.9 billion acquisition by Nvidia, will operate as an independent unit and retain all employees, with plans to grow the workforce in Israel. Mellanox founder and CEO Eyal Waldman will continue to lead the unit. This acquisition marks Nvidia's largest to date, aimed at expanding its reach into data centers crucial for AI and machine learning.

title: Postmates Presents New NVIDIA Jetson AGX Xavier Equipped Delivery Robot at GTC
summary: Postmates unveiled Serve, an all-electric autonomous delivery robot equipped with NVIDIA's Jetson AGX Xavier module, at GTC Silicon Valley. The robot can carry 50 pounds over 30 miles and is designed to efficiently move items over short distances in cities. Serve uses Velodyne LIDAR sensors and NVIDIA's technology, with Postmates aiming for zero-cost deliveries to consumers.

title: NVIDIA’s Isaac SDK brings modern AI to autonomous machines
summary: NVIDIA announced the public availability of its Isaac SDK, a free robotics developer toolbox designed to accelerate innovation and deployment of AI in autonomous machines. The SDK provides Isaac applications, GEMs (robot capabilities), a Robot Engine, and Sim, aiming to simplify the integration of AI for perception, navigation, and manipulation. The platform supports various NVIDIA Jetson platforms, including the new low-cost Jetson Nano, and offers open-source hardware reference designs.

title: Global Computer Companies Announce NVIDIA-Powered Enterprise Servers Optimized for Data Science
summary: Seven major systems manufacturers, including Cisco, Dell EMC, and HPE, are now offering NVIDIA T4 servers optimized for data science. These NVIDIA NGC-Ready validated servers feature T4 GPUs and CUDA-X AI acceleration libraries, providing a highly efficient platform for data analytics, machine learning, and deep learning. NVIDIA also launched an enterprise support service for NGC-Ready systems and announced T4 server certifications for virtual desktop and application virtualization solutions.

title: Nearly Half of Israel's Largest Exporters Are Foreign-Owned
summary: Nearly half of Israel's 20 largest exporters, each with over $1 billion in annual sales, are foreign-owned, according to Calcalist data. Five are U.S.-owned, two European-owned, and one each by Chinese and Mexican companies. This trend was underscored by Nvidia's $6.9 billion acquisition of Israeli chipmaker Mellanox Technologies Ltd.

title: ‘Happy and sad day,’ Mellanox founder says of $6.9 billion sale to Nvidia
summary: Mellanox Technologies founder and CEO Eyal Waldman expressed mixed feelings about Nvidia's $6.9 billion acquisition of his company, calling it a "happy and sad day." The deal, Israel’s second-largest tech acquisition, will see Nvidia acquire Mellanox for $125 a share, aiming to strengthen its position in the data center components market. Waldman, who founded Mellanox in 1999, indicated that while the sale was the right move for shareholders and employees, his own future at the firm remains undecided.

title: Nvidia to buy Mellanox for $6.9 billion as it pushes into data centers
summary: Nvidia has agreed to acquire chipmaker Mellanox Technologies Ltd. for $6.9 billion, a move aimed at bolstering its presence in the expanding data center market. The acquisition is Nvidia's largest ever and seeks to accelerate its successful initiatives in providing graphics chips for artificial intelligence work in data centers. The deal signals a potential resumption of consolidation within the semiconductor industry, despite concerns about regulatory approvals amid the U.S.-China trade war.

title: US gaming firm Nvidia to buy Israeli chip maker Mellanox for $6.9 billion
summary: US gaming and computer graphics giant Nvidia Corp. is set to acquire Israeli chip maker Mellanox Technologies Ltd. for $6.9 billion in cash. This deal marks the second-largest tech acquisition in Israel's history and will enhance Nvidia's capabilities in high-speed data center solutions. Mellanox, founded in 1999, specializes in servers and storage switching solutions and has seen significant demand for its products.

title: Nvidia to make largest acquisition in its history with $6.9 billion deal for Mellanox
NVIDIA to pay $6.9 billion for Israeli company Mellanox
summary: NVIDIA is set to acquire Israeli company Mellanox for $6.9 billion. This acquisition highlights a significant investment in Israeli technology and business, as ISRAEL21c is now part of the Unpacked family, focusing on smart, engaging, and inspiring content about Israel, Judaism, and the Jewish experience.

title: Nvidia acquires Mellanox against growing AI, data competition
summary: Nvidia has acquired Mellanox Technologies Ltd. for $6.9 billion to strengthen its position in the rapidly growing and competitive market for AI and data-intensive computing platforms. This merger aims to bolster their combined capabilities against new rivals like Amazon and Cray, as both companies already have a significant presence in high-performance computing (HPC) with their integrated technologies. The acquisition is seen as a strategic move to address increasing competitive challenges in the HPC market.

title: Nvidia to Acquire Mellanox, Its Biggest Deal Ever at Roughly $7 Billion
summary: Nvidia has agreed to acquire networking firm Mellanox Technologies Ltd. for approximately $6.9 billion, marking its largest acquisition to date. This move is aimed at strengthening Nvidia's position in cloud computing, following a downturn in its core graphics-chips business. The deal signifies Nvidia's continued expansion beyond its traditional graphics processing unit market into new technology areas.

title: Machine learning is the biggest disruptive tech: AMD CTO Mark Papermaster
summary: AMD CTO Mark Papermaster discusses the significance of the company's new 7nm chips in meeting the insatiable demand for computational power, especially in data centers and mobile devices. He highlights machine learning as the biggest disruptive technology, noting its potential to leverage data and predict results, while also addressing concerns about AI and robotics replacing human jobs. Papermaster also touches on GPU usage in the crypto space, indicating AMD's focus on broader GPU markets in gaming, servers, and blockchain.

title: Coke stock heads for worst day since 2008, Nvidia looks to capitalize on ‘positive set up’
summary: Coca-Cola Co. (Coke) stock is experiencing a significant downturn, heading for its worst day since 2008, largely due to "softness" in its North America business, a revenue miss, and a disappointing outlook for the year. The company is facing challenges in regions like Argentina and Turkey and plans to increase marketing expenses in 2019, despite some encouraging trends in North America and China. The article also mentions Nvidia looking to capitalize on a positive setup, alongside other earnings watch updates for Six Flags, Avon, and Yeti.

title: Make Your Data Pipeline Super-Efficient by Unifying Machine Learning and Deep Learning
summary: This article discusses how NetApp and NVIDIA technologies can unify and accelerate data pipelines for machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL). It highlights the inefficiencies of traditional approaches that separate data preparation, ML, and DL stages, and proposes a combined solution using NVIDIA RAPIDS and NetApp's Data Fabric and ONTAP AI to create a seamless, end-to-end AI pipeline from edge to core to cloud. The integration aims to reduce data sprawl, improve processing efficiency, and solve specific data science challenges with features like FabricPool, FlexCache, and FlexClone.

title: SoftBank Sells Entire Nvidia Stake
summary: SoftBank's nearly $100 billion Vision Fund sold its entire 4.9% stake in Nvidia Corp. in January, realizing a $3.3 billion return. This move comes as Nvidia's shares have been affected by trade war fears and projected lower-than-expected revenue, leading to a nearly 50% loss in value since October 2018.

title: Aehr launches FOX-CP wafer-level test & reliability screening system
summary: Aehr Test Systems has launched the FOX-CP, a new low-cost single-wafer test and reliability verification system designed for logic, memory, and photonic devices. This system, part of the FOX-P product family, is optimized for shorter test times, multiple touchdowns, and includes features like 2048 Universal Channels, making it suitable for silicon photonics and VCSEL arrays. The FOX-CP helps reduce test costs by identifying failing die before packaging and is available for order and shipment.

title: NVIDIA Responds to TRC Capital’s ‘Mini-Tender’ Offer
summary: NVIDIA has issued a response to an unsolicited "mini-tender" offer from TRC Capital Corporation to purchase up to 1,000,000 shares of NVIDIA's common stock at $149.88 per share. NVIDIA is not affiliated with TRC, expresses no opinion on the offer, and advises shareholders to consult with their brokers or financial advisors and exercise caution. The company also clarified that a mini-tender offer is an offer for less than 5 percent of a company’s shares and is not subject to the same disclosure requirements as larger tender offers.

title: Opinion: AMD has won Wall Street’s trust, and its stock is showing the results
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and CEO Lisa Su have successfully built credibility with Wall Street, reflected in the company's stock performance. Despite a recent revenue miss and a rival's warning, the company's ability to meet its commitments has fostered belief in its future forecasts, which are heavily weighted towards the second half of the year. This marks a significant turnaround for AMD, a company that previously struggled with Wall Street's trust.

title: Opinion: AMD has won Wall Street’s trust, and its stock is showing the results
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has gained significant credibility on Wall Street, a trust it previously lacked. Despite reporting slightly below-expectation fourth-quarter revenue and a first-quarter outlook due to excess graphics chip inventories, the stock did not face a typical decline. This indicates Wall Street's growing faith in CEO Lisa Su's ability to deliver, especially with a forecast heavily weighted to the second half of the year.

title: Will Top-Down Hardware/Software Co-Design Ever Happen?
summary: This article discusses the long-standing challenge and evolution of hardware/software co-design in the EDA industry over the past two decades. Author Frank Schirrmeister reflects on past predictions and notes the significant progress made in verification, virtual prototyping, and the "shift left" methodology, even if not exactly as anticipated. He concludes that new abstraction layers and tools, like those for iOS and Android, and middleware like OpenGL, are enabling a new level of hardware/software optimization.

title: China weakness spreads far and wide, from Caterpillar to Nvidia
summary: Major US and European companies like Caterpillar, Nvidia, and Intel are reporting significant impacts from the slowing demand in China across various sectors, from industrial machinery and technology to automotive parts. While many industries are feeling the pinch, luxury goods and some consumer brands like Tiffany & Co. and Starbucks are, for now, experiencing continued growth, creating a mixed economic picture. The emerging trend suggests a broadening slowdown in China is affecting a diverse range of goods and services.

title: Caterpillar, Nvidia Warnings Send Wall Street Tumbling
summary: U.S. stocks tumbled following warnings from Caterpillar and Nvidia, which highlighted concerns about a slowing Chinese economy and the impact of tariffs on corporate profits. Caterpillar missed profit estimates due to softening demand in China and rising costs, while Nvidia cut its revenue forecast due to weak demand and lower data center sales. This sent major indexes like the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite lower, despite overall positive earnings reports.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Amazon Stock Rises as the 'Scout' Delivery Robot Is Unveiled
summary: Amazon announced the launch of its new delivery robot, "Scout," a cooler-sized ground unit designed for autonomous package delivery, initially accompanied by an Amazon employee. This announcement led to a 0.91 percent rise in Amazon's stock prices. The article also mentions other strong performers in the Entrepreneur Index™, including NVIDIA Corp. and Analog Devices, while J.M. Smucker Company, OReilly Auto Parts, and Brown-Forman Corp saw declines.

title: Corsair Vengeance 5180 gaming PC review: "A beautiful machine with performance to match"
summary: This article reviews the Corsair Vengeance 5180 gaming PC, highlighting its powerful components, excellent dual-chamber design, and brilliant RGB lighting. While acknowledging its large size and non-overclockable CPU, the review praises its performance at 1080p and 1440p and its overall value for gamers seeking a pre-built machine.

title: NVIDIA Resets The Self-Driving Bar Again With AutoPilot Supporting 'Level 2+'
summary: NVIDIA announced its DRIVE AutoPilot system at CES 2019, which it describes as the "world's first commercially available Level 2+ automated driving system" that will enable supervised self-driving vehicles by 2020. The company also revealed that Mercedes-Benz has chosen NVIDIA as its AI partner for developing next-generation vehicles. Additionally, NVIDIA launched the new GeForce RTX 2060 GPU and announced over 40 new gaming laptops featuring GeForce RTX GPUs.

title: Ambarella's CV25 camera SoC with CVflow computer vision processing | Security News
summary: Ambarella has unveiled the CV25 camera System-on-Chip (SoC), part of its CVflow family, designed for next-generation intelligent solutions. This SoC integrates advanced image processing, high-resolution video encoding, and CVflow computer vision processing into a low-power design. The CV25 enables AI at the edge for applications like home monitoring, surveillance, and automotive solutions, supporting features such as facial recognition and driver monitoring.

title: Opinion: AMD’s Lisa Su takes center stage at CES, taking aim at Intel and Nvidia
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su used her CES keynote to confidently declare that the company expects to challenge and potentially surpass bigger rivals like Intel and Nvidia. She detailed AMD’s 2019 plans for computers, servers, and videogames, featuring new high-end graphics cards and a second-generation server chip. Su showcased the performance of early versions of AMD's 7-nanometer hardware against offerings from its competitors.

title: Opinion: AMD’s Lisa Su takes center stage at CES, taking aim at Intel and Nvidia
summary: During her CES keynote, AMD CEO Lisa Su declared the company's intention to challenge and potentially surpass rivals Intel and Nvidia. She outlined AMD's 2019 strategies for computers, servers, and videogames, showcasing early performance of its 7-nanometer hardware. Su emphasized that the company's significant investments are now yielding results and are expected to continue doing so throughout 2019.

title: Opinion: AMD’s Lisa Su takes center stage at CES, taking aim at Intel and Nvidia
Brain Corp Using NVIDIA Jetson for Latest Robotics Product Powered by BrainOS®
summary: Brain Corp announced it is using NVIDIA Jetson for its latest autonomous commercial vacuum cleaner, "Whiz," developed with SoftBank Robotics. Powered by BrainOS®, its proprietary operating system, Whiz offers autonomous navigation and data collection for commercial spaces. The product was showcased at an NVIDIA event, highlighting its advanced safety and performance capabilities for the Japanese market starting in 2019.

title: Adobe Named The Best Tech Company to Work For in India List
summary: Adobe has been named the top tech company to work for in India in a 2018 report by job search portal Indeed, followed by Nvidia and Microsoft. The report highlights that Indian job seekers prefer large international firms for career advancement and work exposure in the technology sector. Multinational corporations dominated the list, reinforcing the demand for such companies in India's job market.

title: Watch AI conjure up an entire city from scratch
summary: Nvidia, in collaboration with the University of California, Berkeley, has developed an AI-powered driving simulator that generates entire cities in real-time. This technology, learned from segmented driver camera footage, showcases the potential for AI to automate virtual world creation, providing a rapid prototyping tool for architects and city planners. It also highlights the future where AI graphics could make digital fiction indistinguishable from reality.

title: To handle the data tsunami, Juniper’s founder turns to custom silicon
summary: Fungible Inc., founded by Juniper Networks Inc. founder Pradeep Sindhu, is developing custom silicon in the form of a data processing unit (DPU) to address the challenge of booming data volumes and the slowdown of Moore's Law. The company aims to optimize data movement and storage in data centers, focusing on data-centric computing and hardware/software integration to meet the demands of massively scalable data centers and edge computing. Despite initial venture capital skepticism, Fungible secured $32 million in funding, and its approach is validated by other tech giants also pursuing custom silicon solutions.

title: XPENG Motors partners with NVIDIA to develop Level 3 autonomous driving technology for China
summary: XPENG Motors has partnered with NVIDIA and its China partner Desay SV to develop Level 3 autonomous driving technology specifically for the Chinese market. The collaboration will leverage NVIDIA's Xavier AI supercomputing system, with XPENG self-developing the software for China's unique traffic conditions and Desay SV developing the computing hardware. The company plans to implement these intelligent driving features, including parking pilot and highway pilot, in its new models starting in 2020.

title: Chip and Dip: Is Semiconductor Weakness a Leveraged Buying Opportunity?
summary: The semiconductor sector experienced a downturn, particularly affecting leveraged ETFs like SOXL, due to Nvidia missing revenue expectations for its third quarter. Despite the recent declines, some analysts suggest this weakness could present a buying opportunity for traders willing to take a risk, especially considering tech investor Paul Meeks's view on an ongoing "inventory correction" in the industry. The article explores whether this dip signifies a chance for bold investors to enter the market.

title: Nvidia tumbles 19% after missing on revenue and guidance
summary: Nvidia's stock dropped 18.8 percent after the company missed analyst expectations for third-quarter 2019 revenue and provided lower-than-anticipated guidance for the next quarter. The company cited surplus inventory, particularly in its midrange Pascal gaming segment, as a major factor. This news also caused a 3.9 percent drop in shares for competitor Advanced Micro Devices.

title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) earnings Q3 2019
summary: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) reported a surge in Q3 2019 earnings per share, beating estimates, despite revenue falling short of expectations and weak Q4 guidance. The company's stock dropped 16% in after-hours trading due to the revenue miss and outlook. Nvidia saw strong growth in its Datacenter business and other segments, while also announcing increased dividends and share repurchase plans.

title: When Robots Ring the Bell (Published 2018)
summary: Robo Global celebrated the fifth anniversary of its robotics index and exchange-traded fund at the New York Stock Exchange by having a robot ring the closing bell. This event symbolized the growing integration of robotics and artificial intelligence into various sectors of the economy. Experts describe this shift as the fourth industrial revolution, highlighting the massive growth potential and increasing prevalence of automation to boost productivity.

title: Why style differentiation matters in US equity investing
summary: This article discusses the importance of style differentiation in US equity investing, particularly highlighting the outperformance of large-cap growth funds over the last five years. It examines how technology stocks have driven this growth, recent reclassifications of S&P 500 sectors, and the debate among investors regarding the sustainability of this trend versus the potential for value-based strategies to rebound, emphasizing the merits of combining growth and value styles.

title: Artificial intelligence: Investing in a friend and foe
summary: This article discusses the profound impact of artificial intelligence (AI) and the investment opportunities it presents. It highlights AI's rapid advancements, its disruptive potential across various industries, and provides investment options like ETFs for Australian investors, despite some skepticism and challenges.

title: Restaurant Brands (QSR) to Repurchase 10M Class B Exchangeable Limited Partnership Units
summary: Restaurant Brands International Inc. (QSR) and RBI LP announced that 3G Restaurant Brands Holdings LP will exchange over 11 million Class B exchangeable limited partnership units. RBI LP intends to repurchase 10 million of these units for cash and deliver the remaining 1.1 million as common shares of the Company. The cash repurchase will be financed with available cash on hand and will be based on the 20-day volume weighted average price of the Company's common shares.

title: How to invest in UAE stock markets
summary: This article provides guidance on how retail investors can invest in UAE stock markets, including advice on finding brokers, available products like ETFs and REITs, and considerations for investing in local stocks. Issam Kassabieh, a senior financial analyst at Menacorp, offers insights into defensive sectors, high-growth stocks, and risk management specific to the UAE market.

title: Nvidia’s Overbought Shares Seen Falling 9% Short Term
summary: Nvidia's shares, despite a significant year-to-date rise, are predicted to fall by as much as 9% in the short term due to technical analysis indicating an overbought condition and bearish divergence. However, the long-term outlook remains strong, supported by healthy analyst estimates for earnings and revenue growth in the upcoming quarter and the balance of the year. Analysts have been raising their future growth outlooks for the company, suggesting any short-term pullback may be temporary.

title: AMD Stock Price Has Paused, Investors Should Pause As Well
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) experienced a significant stock surge but has since paused in the mid-$30s. While AMD's long-term outlook remains promising due to its technological advancements and competitive gains against Intel and Nvidia, its current valuation is considered high, suggesting investors should proceed with caution in the short term. The article advises waiting for a modest pullback or for financials to catch up before investing, highlighting strong long-term fundamentals despite the current overvaluation.

title: This Tech Company May Be Near a ‘Tipping Point’ in Dominating Artificial Intelligence
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) is seen by an Evercore analyst as being on the verge of becoming the artificial intelligence industry's standard platform, potentially leading to over 40% upside for its stock. The analyst, C.J. Muse, raised his price target to $400, citing the company's deep-learning platform and its applicability across various sectors like gaming, healthcare, and autonomous machinery. Muse also highlighted an "elongated" gaming cycle driven by technologies like ray tracing and deep learning super sampling, which he believes will drive significant demand.

title: ON Semiconductor Positioning Itself As A Leader In Self-Driving Car Technologies
summary: ON Semiconductor is establishing itself as a key player in self-driving car technologies by manufacturing all three primary sensor types: LiDAR, radar, and cameras. The company differentiates itself with a range of CMOS sensors for cameras and has strategically acquired SensL Technologies for LiDAR and an RF team for radar development. ON Semiconductor's technologies are integrated into major self-driving ecosystems like Intel Mobileye, NVIDIA Drive PX, and Baidu Apollo, positioning it as a comprehensive sensor solution provider for both self-driving and advanced assistive driving applications.

title: Opinion: Nvidia outlines how the company will grow for the next 10 years
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang outlined the company's growth strategy for the next decade at the GPU Technology Conference in Japan. The plan focuses on expanding Nvidia's leadership in artificial intelligence (AI) by strengthening the secondary AI field of inference compute. Additionally, the company aims to solidify plans for its technology to span a wide range of market segments.

title: Fujifilm Becomes First Company in Japan to Adopt the NVIDIA DGX-2 Supercomputer
summary: Fujifilm has become the first company in Japan to adopt the NVIDIA DGX-2 AI supercomputer for its AI development across various fields, including healthcare and medical imaging. This adoption is expected to significantly boost processing power, reducing AI learning times from days to hours. The DGX-2 system, featuring 16 NVIDIA Tesla V100 Tensor Core GPUs, aims to accelerate the development, testing, and deployment of new deep learning models.

title: How this CEO avoided the glass cliff and turned around an "uninvestable" company
summary: Lisa Su, CEO of AMD, successfully turned around the struggling tech company after it faced significant losses and was deemed "uninvestable." Her strategy focused on three clear objectives: building great products, deepening customer relationships, and simplifying operations, while also fostering an open and learning-oriented company culture. Su's pragmatic leadership and communication style helped AMD achieve 25% revenue growth in 2017 and return to profitability.

title: Nvidia’s GPU cloud for deep learning can now be accessed via Microsoft Azure
summary: Microsoft Corp. has partnered with Nvidia Corp. to enable its Azure cloud customers to utilize Nvidia's GPU Cloud for training deep learning models. This integration provides developers, data scientists, and researchers access to preconfigured containers with GPU-accelerated software, supporting popular deep learning tools like Microsoft’s Cognitive Toolkit, TensorFlow, and PyTorch, and using advanced Nvidia GPUs such as the Tesla V100. The collaboration aims to streamline high-powered computing tasks on Azure, complementing Microsoft's Project Brainwave initiative.

title: NVIDIA RTX Platform Brings Real-Time Ray Tracing and AI to Barrage of Blockbuster Games
summary: NVIDIA announced that its RTX platform, featuring real-time ray tracing and AI capabilities, is being adopted by top game developers for a host of blockbuster games, including Battlefield V and Shadow of the Tomb Raider. The Turing architecture's RT Cores enable realistic shadows, reflections, and global illumination, while Tensor Cores power Deep Learning Super-Sampling (DLSS) for improved rendering. This advancement brings industry-standard real-time ray tracing and AI to gaming, marking a significant leap in graphical fidelity.

title: Opinion: Nvidia says crypto-mining boom is over for now
summary: Nvidia's CFO Colette Kress has stated that the crypto-mining boom is over for the company, expecting no contributions from crypto-related sales for the rest of the year. This announcement was made following the release of their second-quarter earnings, which showed a shortfall in anticipated crypto sales. The company had previously benefited significantly from selling its graphics chips to cryptocurrency miners.

title: NVIDIA Reinvents Computer Graphics with Turing Architecture
summary: NVIDIA announced its new Turing GPU architecture, marking a significant advancement in computer graphics with the introduction of real-time ray tracing through new RT Cores and AI inferencing via Tensor Cores. This hybrid rendering approach aims to revolutionize the visual effects industry and bring cinematic-quality interactive experiences to designers and artists. The company also unveiled its initial Turing-based products, the NVIDIA® Quadro® RTX™ 8000, 6000, and 5000 GPUs.

title: TSMC Chip Maker Blames WannaCry Malware for Production Halt
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) experienced a production halt across several chip-fabrication factories due to a variant of the WannaCry malware. The cyberattack, which was not a direct hack but rather an infection spread through tainted software installed by a supplier, is expected to impact revenue by approximately $256 million and cause shipment delays. Although full operations have resumed, the incident raises concerns, especially for key customers like Apple, for whom TSMC is a sole supplier of SoC components.

title: AMD Stock Breaks Out but Approaches Overbought Levels
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock rose 2.5% after Cowen & Co. reiterated an Outperform rating and raised its price target, citing opportunities in data centers and client markets, especially with upcoming 7nm products. This upgrade follows Intel's 10nm chip delay, which could allow AMD to gain market share. Despite breaking out to new highs, technical indicators suggest the stock is approaching overbought levels, potentially leading to consolidation before further gains.

title: Self-Driving Startup Pony.ai Secures $214 Million Since January
summary: Self-driving startup Pony.ai, founded by former Baidu and Google veterans, has secured $214 million in funding within its first six months of operation in 2018. The capital will be used to expand its autonomous vehicle fleet, increase headcount, and accelerate market entry. The company's recent funding rounds highlight growing investor confidence in its team, technology, and commercialization path, as China races to develop its self-driving car sector with new national regulations.

title: Intel co-founder Gordon Moore reflects on company’s 50-year history
summary: Intel co-founder Gordon Moore reflects on the company's 50-year history in an interview. He discusses the origin of Intel's name, its location in Santa Clara, and his mindset during his tenure as CEO. The article notes that Intel is celebrating its 50th anniversary on July 18, 2018.

title: Big Trouble At 3nm
summary: Developing chips at the 3nm node presents significant challenges, with design costs potentially reaching $1.5 billion and questions surrounding the real-world benefits of gate-all-around technologies like nanosheet and nanowire FETs. While some companies like Samsung and GlobalFoundries are pushing forward with nanosheet FETs, others like TSMC are still exploring options, and the industry faces hurdles in manufacturing, process control, and interconnects, suggesting a potentially long and costly transition. The article also highlights a shift where finFETs might struggle at 3nm, necessitating a move to new transistor architectures.

title: Goldman Sachs, Deepak Chopra, and Paul Tudor Jones Are Launching a New Investment Fund, but It’s Good
summary: Goldman Sachs and Paul Tudor Jones' nonprofit, Just Capital, have launched a new values-driven investment fund called the JUST U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (ticker: JUST). This ETF offers investors a diversified basket of 500 large U.S. companies chosen based on crowdsourced American values, providing an ethical alternative to traditional indexes like the S&P 500. While not guaranteed to outperform, it allows investors to align their portfolios with companies that rank high on metrics like worker treatment, customer care, environmental impact, and tax payments.

title: U of T computer vision expert to lead new Nvidia research lab in Toronto
summary: Nvidia is opening a new AI research lab in Toronto, led by University of Toronto's Sanja Fidler, an expert in computer vision and applied machine learning. This move triples Nvidia's research presence in Toronto and reinforces the city's status as a top AI hub, attracting deep-pocketed multinationals and fostering a vibrant innovation ecosystem. Fidler will remain an assistant professor at U of T Mississauga while spearheading cutting-edge research projects in machine learning, computer vision, and graphics at the new lab.

title: Sector Watch: Good times for American growth
summary: Despite trade tensions, rising interest rates, and stock market volatility, U.S. stocks are showing continued optimism driven by strong economic growth, lower taxes, and declining unemployment. Fund managers Tony Genua of AGF Investments Inc. and Noah Blackstein of 1832 Asset Management LP are identifying investment opportunities in innovative companies across technology, financial services, and healthcare sectors, focusing on high-growth potential and sustainable expansion. Both managers emphasize active portfolio management and selective stock-picking, with a focus on market leaders and disruptive technologies while managing risk through diversification and profit-taking.

title: Microchip (MCHP) Completes Microsemi Acquisition for $10.3B
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. (MCHP) has completed its acquisition of Microsemi Corporation for $10.3 billion, a deal announced on March 1, 2018. The acquisition, valued at $10.15 billion in total enterprise value, involved Microchip paying $68.78 per share in cash to Microsemi shareholders. This move is expected to be immediately accretive to Microchip's non-GAAP earnings and is projected to generate approximately $300 million in synergies by the third year post-closure.

title: Supermicro Unveils 2 PetaFLOPS SuperServer Based on New NVIDIA HGX-2, the World’s Most Powerful Cloud Server Platform for AI and HPC
summary: Supermicro announced its adoption of the NVIDIA HGX-2 cloud server platform to develop the world's most powerful systems for AI and HPC, capable of delivering over double the performance. The new HGX-2 system features 16 Tesla V100 32GB SXM3 GPUs connected via NVLink and NVSwitch, functioning as a unified 2 PetaFlop accelerator with half a terabyte of aggregate memory. This innovation is crucial for training increasingly large and complex AI models and handling demanding HPC applications, helping to save significant cost, space, and energy in data centers.

title: Companies to watch: General Electric, Fifth Third Bank, Microsoft and Nvidia
summary: General Electric is merging its locomotive business with Wabtec in an $11 billion deal, aiming for significant free cash flow. Fifth Third Bank is acquiring MB Financial for $4.7 billion, which will expand its presence in Chicago. Microsoft and Nvidia are both making strides in artificial intelligence, with Microsoft buying Semantic Machines to improve AI voice and Nvidia developing tech to teach robots by observation.

title: Startup Develops an AI-based System to Treat Neurological Disorders
summary: BrainQ, an Israeli AI startup, has developed a deep learning-based system to treat neurological disorders, particularly focusing on stroke and spinal cord injury patients. The company uses NVIDIA GPUs and TensorFlow to analyze brain waves and generate precise treatment plans, and recently secured $8.8 million in funding to expand its non-invasive brain-computer interface simulation device, support clinical trials, and grow its EEG database. BrainQ aims to revolutionize neuro-recovery by using AI-based precision medicine and currently holds the largest brain-computer interface-based EEG database for motor tasks.

title: Nvidia Q1 2019 earnings
summary: Nvidia reported record first-quarter 2019 results, with net income more than doubling to $1.24 billion and revenues surging 66% to $3.21 billion, driven by strong growth in gaming and datacenter segments. Despite crushing estimates, the company's shares dipped over 2% after the announcement. Nvidia plans to return $1.25 billion to stockholders in fiscal 2019 and projects Q2 revenues of around $3.10 billion.

title: NetApp Announces AFF A800, ONTAP 9.4, & New Cloud Services
summary: NetApp has announced significant updates including the new AFF A800 all-flash array, ONTAP 9.4, and new intelligent cloud services such as NetApp Cloud Volumes for Google Cloud Platform. These advancements aim to support high-performance AI and ML workloads, offering end-to-end NVMe capabilities and enhanced hybrid cloud data management. The company is also partnering with NVIDIA and Broadcom to further strengthen its offerings in AI and Fibre Channel compatibility.

title: SoundHound Secures $100M To Amp Voice AI Platform, New Alliances.
summary: Sound-recognition company SoundHound has secured $100 million in new funding, bringing its total funding to $215 million. The company plans to use the funds to drive the adoption and distribution of its Houndify voice AI platform across various verticals and accelerate global expansion. This funding also forges alliances with leading companies like Tencent Holdings and Daimler AG, providing access to over 2 billion consumers globally.

title: TSMC launches WoW 3D chip packaging tech
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSMC) has introduced its new Wafer-on-Wafer (WoW) 3D stacked chip technology, aiming to double transistor density without increasing chip footprint. This new packaging technique, built on existing CoWoS and InFO methods, involves bonding two wafers face-to-face and connecting them via through-silicon vias. TSMC also announced an enhanced 7nm+ process node and plans for 5nm parts in early 2019.

title: ‘Unpatchable’ Nvidia Tegra X-1 flaw affects Nintendo Switch and other devices
summary: A security researcher has uncovered an "unpatchable" vulnerability, dubbed Fusée Gelée, in Nvidia Corp.'s Tegra X-1 chips that affects devices like the Nintendo Switch and Google Pixel C. This flaw exploits the chip’s USB recovery mode to bypass security and run custom code, posing a significant risk as it is hardware-based and cannot be patched post-manufacture. While Nintendo may be able to detect hacked systems via software updates, the core vulnerability remains.

title: GTC 2018: Nvidia’s bet on AI, machine learning paying off
summary: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang discussed the company's successful pivot towards AI and machine learning, transforming it from a graphics card designer into a computing architecture and software company. This strategic shift has resulted in significant stock growth and revenue increases, cementing Nvidia's position as a leader in the GPU and AI markets, despite warnings from analysts about potential regulation and competition.

title: JPMorgan U.S. Quality Factor ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NYSEARCA:JQUA)
summary: The JPMorgan U.S. Quality Factor ETF (JQUA) is an exchange-traded fund that tracks the JP Morgan US Quality Factor index, focusing on profitability, earnings, and solvency from the Russell 1000 companies. JQUA was launched on November 8, 2017, and is managed by JPMorgan Chase, with holdings including major tech companies like Alphabet, Broadcom, and Apple. The ETF has performed well, with its stock increasing by 10.6% this year to $63.34 as of the latest data.

title: HP Intel 8th gen Pavilion gaming laptops and desktops launched - Systems - News
summary: HP has launched new Pavilion Gaming PC products, including two desktops, one laptop, and one desktop monitor, aiming to provide "Powerful PC Gaming Experiences to the Masses" for casual gamers. These products feature Intel 8th Gen Core processors (or AMD Ryzen for desktops), various GPU options from Nvidia and AMD, and flexible storage and display configurations. The new line sits below HP's premium Omen gaming series, offering a balance of performance and affordability.

title: Sunlands Technology Group (STG) Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Sunlands Technology Group (STG) stock, an online education service provider based in China. It covers key financial metrics, company overview, analyst ratings, earnings, short interest, insider ownership, news headlines, and frequently asked questions about its stock performance. The company specializes in K-12, college entrance exam, and professional qualification test preparation through its digital platform.

title: HP Revamps Pavilion PCs with Premium Features and Design
summary: HP Inc. introduced its next-generation Pavilion portfolio, featuring convertibles, notebooks, and desktops with premium features and expressive designs. The lineup includes thinner bezels, refined materials, stepped-up performance options, and will debut at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival. HP also launched a new Pavilion Gaming portfolio to bring powerful PC gaming experiences to a broader audience.

title: HP Brings Powerful PC Gaming Experiences to the Masses
summary: HP Inc. introduced its new HP Pavilion Gaming lineup, offering notebooks, desktops, and displays tailored for mainstream gamers seeking powerful performance, bold design, and everyday versatility. This new portfolio aims to cater to the 62% of the growing gaming market who are more casual users, complementing HP's OMEN line built for enthusiasts. The lineup includes new laptops, desktops, and a 32-inch HDR display, providing a range of options for gaming and creative tasks, all at accessible price points.

title: The AI compilation wars: Intel, Google, Microsoft, Nvidia, IBM and others arm for deep learning acceleration
summary: The article discusses the growing "AI compilation wars" as major tech companies like Intel, Google, Microsoft, Nvidia, and IBM develop cross-platform compilers for deep learning acceleration. These compilers aim to enable AI models built with various front-end tools to run optimally on diverse back-end hardware, fostering a future where AI developers can abstract their models and compile them for hybridized hardware environments. The trend highlights a move towards open-source, framework-agnostic AI development.

title: William Tang wins 2018 Global Impact Award to advance development of AI software to help create a 'star on earth’
summary: Physicist William Tang has received a $100,000 Global Impact Award from NVIDIA Corp. for his work in artificial intelligence computing. Tang leads a team developing AI machine learning software called "deep learning" to predict and mitigate disruptive events in fusion reactions, specifically in tokamaks, aiming to make fusion power achievable. Their software, Fusion Recurrent Neural Network (FRNN), has significantly improved the speed and accuracy of disruption predictions using data from the Joint European Torus (JET).

title: New HP Z8 is "World’s Most Powerful Workstation for Machine Learning Development"
summary: HP has launched new machine learning solutions, including the HP Z8 workstation, which they claim is the "world's most powerful workstation for ML development." These workstations, featuring NVIDIA technology, are designed for local processing at the network's edge, offering developers enhanced control, performance, and security over cloud-based solutions. The company also introduced the HP ML Developer Portal and expanded services to accelerate machine learning adoption across various industries.

title: Opinion: If the FAANGs have got you down, it’s time to win with the WNSSS stocks
summary: This opinion piece suggests a new acronym for dominant tech stocks, "WNSSS," as an alternative to the well-known "FAANG" stocks. The author believes companies like Weibo, Nvidia, ServiceNow, Square, and Shopify have the potential to lead the market in the future, much like the FAANG companies did in the past. The article acknowledges the past success of FAANG stocks, an acronym coined by Jim Cramer.

title: Opinion: If the FAANGs have got you down, it’s time to win with the WNSSS stocks
summary: This article suggests that investors look beyond the traditional FAANG stocks (Facebook, Amazon, Netflix, Google, Apple) and consider a new set of companies, dubbed "WNSSS" stocks. These include Weibo, Nvidia, ServiceNow, Square, and Shopify, which are posited as potential future market leaders. The piece highlights that while FAANGs have dominated in the past, new tech players are emerging that could offer greater growth opportunities.

title: GTC 2018: Autonomous vehicle development should continue, urges Nvidia boss
summary: Nvidia CEO Jen-Hsun Huang argues that autonomous vehicle development, particularly in safety, must continue and investments should increase despite a recent fatal accident involving an Uber self-driving car. He emphasizes that the technology is intended to save lives and calls for patience while investigations into the incident are ongoing. Nvidia itself temporarily halted its AV testing to assess new data but continues development using simulators.

title: Nvidia Halts Self-Driving Car Tests After Uber Mishap
summary: Nvidia halted its global self-driving car tests following a fatal accident involving one of Uber Technology Inc.'s autonomous vehicles, which utilized Nvidia's computing platform. The company emphasized caution in developing self-driving technology and stated that testing on public roads is temporarily suspended while manually driven data collection vehicles continue to operate. This incident has impacted the autonomous vehicle industry, causing Nvidia's stock (NVDA) and Tesla's stock (TSLA) to fall, highlighting the challenges and risks associated with the burgeoning sector.

title: NVIDIA Reinvents the Workstation with Real-Time Ray Tracing
summary: NVIDIA has introduced the Quadro GV100 GPU with NVIDIA RTX technology, bringing real-time ray tracing to artists and designers. This advancement, supported by over two dozen professional design applications, marks the biggest leap in computer graphics in 15 years, enabling faster and more photorealistic rendering. The GV100 GPU offers significant performance boosts for deep learning and simulation, with availability starting in April from major workstation manufacturers.

title: AI Improves the Frequency and Quality of Mobile App Notifications | NVIDIA Technical Blog
summary: Researchers from Leopard Mobile developed a deep learning recommendation system to enhance smartphone notifications and advertisements by predicting user preferences. Utilizing NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 GPUs and the cuDNN-accelerated TensorFlow framework, the system trained on data from over 623 million users. The implementation led to fewer pop-ups, higher click-through rates, and improved 7-day retention, making notifications more personalized and effective.

title: John Deere Bets the Farm on AI, IoT
summary: John Deere is significantly investing in artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning, and IoT to modernize its agricultural and heavy equipment. Through acquisitions like Blue River Technology, Deere is developing innovative solutions such as "See and Spray" technology to reduce herbicide use and improve farming efficiency. The company plans to integrate AI and machine learning into all its equipment, utilizing cloud infrastructure and anticipating future advancements with 5G technology.

title: Corsair One ELITE Review (W/ i7-8700K and GTX 1080 Ti)
summary: This article reviews the Corsair One Elite, a compact gaming and productivity PC featuring an Intel Core i7-8700K processor and an Nvidia GeForce GTX 1080 Ti. It highlights the system's impressive performance, quiet operation, and clever design despite its higher price point. The review details specifications, benchmarks, and comparisons with rival systems, concluding that it's an excellent choice for users prioritizing small form factor and power over upgradeability.

title: AMD vs. Intel: Two CPU giants are battling it out in 2018, but who will win?
summary: This article discusses the CPU battle between AMD and Intel in 2018, highlighting AMD's resurgence with its Ryzen processors and its push into the mobile computing market. It details Intel's struggles with production processes and AMD's strategic advancements with Ryzen Mobile and Zen architecture, predicting a significant shift in the CPU industry. The author evaluates which company is better positioned for success in the coming year, noting AMD's strong performance in desktop CPUs and its expansion into portable devices.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Signs Big Supercomputer Deal with Defense Department
summary: The Defense Department has awarded Hewlett Packard Enterprise a $57 million contract for supercomputers to be used for tasks such as designing helicopters and weather forecasting. This deal is significant for HPE, especially since its 2016 acquisition of supercomputer company SGI, providing continued integration and benefit from inherited contracts. The supercomputers will support the Defense Department's high-performance computing modernization program, enhancing capabilities in military design and analysis.

title: Teleoperated Robots: The Industrial Future Using AR and VR
summary: Teleoperated robots, currently used in medical surgeries and military operations, are evolving with Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) technologies. MIT's CSAIL has developed a VR-based controller using an Oculus Rift headset, allowing human operators to control robots remotely by seeing through the robot's eyes and having their movements mirrored. This advancement promises to integrate these robots more deeply into industrial applications, enhancing control and interaction.

title: ANSYS Discovery Live Enables Real-Time Digital Exploration For Every Engineer
summary: ANSYS has launched Discovery Live, a new simulation technology designed to revolutionize product engineering by enabling real-time digital exploration for every engineer. This breakthrough allows engineers to rapidly simulate designs and explore thousands of design options, significantly reducing prototyping costs and accelerating development. The technology, powered by NVIDIA GPUs, provides instantaneous feedback, empowering engineers to make design changes upfront in the process.

title: Trimble expands management solutions with e-Builder acquisition
summary: Trimble has acquired e-Builder, a construction program management solution, for $500 million to enhance field operations integration and project delivery efficiency. This acquisition, financed through a new $300 million credit facility and cash, highlights a growing trend of collaboration in the construction industry to address productivity gaps. The article also mentions other key partnerships and technological advancements aimed at streamlining construction processes and improving data utilization.

title: Annual Semiconductor Sales Increase 21.6 Percent, Top $400 Billion for First Time
summary: The global semiconductor industry achieved its highest-ever annual sales in 2017, totaling $412.2 billion, representing a 21.6 percent increase over 2016. This growth was driven by increased demand across various products and emerging technologies, with memory products leading as the largest and fastest-growing category. The Semiconductor Industry Association anticipates continued, albeit more modest, growth in 2018 and urges policymakers to support U.S. innovation and competitiveness.

title: Baker Hughes GE and Nvidia team up on AI for the oil and gas industries
summary: Baker Hughes GE and Nvidia are collaborating to bring artificial intelligence and data analytics to the oil and gas industries. Their initiative aims to enhance efficiency and predictability by analyzing data from drilling operations, seismic activity, and sensors using Nvidia's GPU-powered systems. This partnership will leverage Nvidia's AI expertise with Baker Hughes GE's domain knowledge to create new models and cloud-based tools for improved fault detection, diagnostics, and operational optimization in the energy sector.

title: Cryptocurrency mining is now so big it’s showing up in the earnings of the world’s largest chipmaker
authors: Joon Ian Wong and Joshua Wong
summary: Cryptocurrency mining is significantly impacting the earnings of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker. TSMC reported revenues driven by demand from crypto miners for the second consecutive quarter, with an estimated $350-$400 million in revenue from this sector in the previous reporting period, primarily from Bitmain. Despite management's cautious outlook on forecasting future crypto demand, TSMC views deep learning and blockchain technologies as key drivers for semiconductor innovation.

title: United Microelectronics aims for AI innovation on a budget
summary: United Microelectronics (UMC) is shifting its focus to artificial intelligence (AI) applications for cars and consumer electronics, moving away from the maturing smartphone market. The company's co-president, SC Chien, stated that UMC plans to prioritize boosting profit in the coming years. This strategic shift aims to innovate within a budget, leveraging emerging AI opportunities.

title: Computer Vision Company Announces Collaboration with Nvidia, Stock Rallies
summary: Foresight Autonomous Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq-listed) announced that its affiliate, Rail Vision Ltd., is collaborating with Nvidia Corporation on system development, causing Foresight's stock to jump 18%. Foresight also increased its stake in Rail Vision to 32.62% and announced new pilot agreements with Chinese car manufacturers, while Nvidia expands its presence in the autonomous vehicle market, competing with Mobileye. Rail Vision, which develops an automated early warning system for locomotives, is pursuing European licensing and completed significant investment rounds in 2017.

title: Microsoft invests in Adaptive Biotechnologies to develop blood test to detect diseases
summary: Microsoft is partnering with Seattle-based Adaptive Biotechnologies to develop a universal blood test capable of detecting diseases in their early stages by mapping and understanding immune-system responses. Microsoft has made a significant, multi-million dollar investment in Adaptive as part of its Healthcare NExT initiative, leveraging its AI and machine learning capabilities for the project. While a universal test is about a decade away, intermediate tests are expected sooner, aiming to use the immune system's insights for early diagnosis.
